strIntroduction: This tour is a special spotlight on the origins of tags and graffiti with a local focus on Tokyo. We offer a group price where the participant can reserve to be part of a small expedition of max 5 persons or choose our Private option where up to 2 persons can benefit from the photographer's time in a private setting. Also, this tour option provides a set of 5 edited photos of the participants within 72 hours following the tour! THE TOUR: We'll begin our 2 hour mission of urban discovery by meeting up at Meiji-Jingumae (Harajuku) Station, easily accessible by the Fukutoshin or Chiyoda line. After a 15-20 introduction on general photography, we'll set out on our adventure! Let's fly through some key Harajuku spots and creatively photograph and document the stickers, tags and random works of art we find hidden away or in plain sight to see! Your guide will share insight on the origins of particular street artists and creative ways to photograph mundane urban elements. Now for round two: Shibuya! The infamously streets of Shibuya are home to some of the world's most unique, hidden areas and of course: urban art! We will fly through this neighbourhood armed with our cameras and set our sights on capturing all types of urban scrawls. Your specialist guide will be able to explain certain graffiti styles and methods in this one-of-a-kind street photography tour. Since this tour is FULL of information, we'll take a moment at the the adventure's end to recap and perhaps revisit some of the information that was exchanged. We'll end the tour in Shinjuku, a perfect place for you to unwind after a productive run around town. With it's many restaurants, bars and shops: there'll be no shortage of things to do!
strTitle: Discover hidden streets on a Tokyo Graffiti Photo Tour

strIntroduction: Japanese Special Photo Studio Angelle is a photo studio where you can get your portfolio created, one with you looking at your very best in a beautiful Japanese traditional Oiran's kimono. Being a little different from those of Maikos (apprentice geishas), the kimonos of Oiran are more magnificent and sexy. The Oirab that Angelle proposes are decked out in expensive magnificent uchikake (a traditional long outer kimono) like that of a bride. Her hairstyle is not limited to the traditional ones, but comes in many different kinds, to which original creations of floral decorations are added. The result is nothing less than gorgeous. The makeup is also in vivid colors to enhance the costume and the photo shoot. Every customer will be transformed into a fashion model or a movie star. Her photograph will be a dramatic one, the kind that no regular photo studio is capable of achieving because she will be installed in a three-dimensional set like that for a scene in a movie. The makeup of a Maiko is one with a white foundation with red as the keynote. Its finish emphasizes elegance. In Kyoto, the Maiko culture is deeply rooted, boasting a long history, so in order to transform into a Maiko, some restrictions apply. The photo shoot will be done with natural lighting in which the white foundation manifests itself in such a way that a soft natural harmonious effect is achieved in the photograph. The transformation into a Oiran at Angelle is not limited in form. Indeed the new kimono styles for the transformation are limitless in possibilities for realizing the wishes of the customers. Let us turn you into an Oiran! What to bring: - Your own cosmetics. We provide the cosmetics for the Oiran experience but not for afterwards.
strTitle: Get a photo session dressed in Japanese Oiran kimono, Kyoto

strIntroduction: Tokyo’s cocktail scene is like no other and focuses on craftsmanship, the ingredients and integrity of the flavors themselves. The bartenders take their work very seriously and have an artful approach to their craft. This tour is an experience like no other in the world. It's a must if you enjoy making cocktails or simply like drinking them! This tour features four carefully chosen tasting locations that highlight the best cocktails the city has to offer, made by award winning mixologists. One delicious and well-balanced cocktail is included at each bar. Activity details: Let's meet at Nihonbashi station for 7h30pm, the perfect time to begin a cocktail tour! Over the course of the next 3-4 hours, we will hop from place to place in search of Tokyo's finest cocktails and drinks! We will begin in Nihonbashi and visit one cocktail house. We will then take a quick subway ride to Ginza and spend about 1.5 hours to visit 2 award winning locations that will have your taste buds singing, walking between stops. You'll be able to receive insight on local culture and discuss the Japanese cocktail culture while we stroll from place to place. Then, onward to our next neighbourhood: Ebisu! With the help of the Tokyo Metro, we will speed to our next location; all three neighborhood have a different vibe and atmosphere. Perfect to give you a good overview of Tokyo's cocktail scene. We'll conclude our cocktail tour at this final destination where you'll be free to continue your evening, should you choose to! However, should you be ready to return home, we'll gladly escort you back to the nearest metro station.
strTitle: Enjoy Tokyo's Amazing Cocktail Tour!

strIntroduction: When you think of Aomori prefecture, apples come to mind! Hirosaki Apple Park has approximately 65 types of apples and 1,300 apple trees. In the fall, you can try apple picking. Cider Factory Kimori, located in the park, lets you try refreshing cider that tastes as if it was pressed straight from an apple (separate fee required). Hirosaki Castle has a history of over 400 years. Today, it is in the midst of being moved, so you can see the castle without its stone-wall base, something seen only once in 100 years. In addition, in Inakadate you can tour rice paddy art that uses the land as a canvas and has become famous worldwide. There is also a tour of the workshop run by the sword smith, Mitsugu Nakahata who has crafted Japanese swords for many years. While listening to explanations from the sword smith, you can take a sword in hand for a close look. A lunch featuring local foods will be prepared. Enjoy a leisurely lunch at a farmhouse restaurant that doesn't have a menu--it serves whatever has been freshly picked that day. After strolling around Hirosaki Park, sit down with a cup of coffee at a Starbucks housed in a cultural property (coffee is a separate fee). The final leg of the tour takes you to a market very popular with the locals that sells foods unique to the area and miscellaneous goods at reasonable prices. Have fun communicating with the women of the market! At night, stay at Ishiba Ryokan, a traditional Japanese inn that is also popluar with foreigners, and enjoy warm hospitality and a traditional Japanese building designated a registered tangible cultural property. This 2-day tour lets you experience an abundance of the enchantment of both Aomori's past and present! Schedule: Day 1 9:00 Gather at Joto Exit, Hirosaki Station; meet up with the guide and travel to Inakadate in a vehicle (van or regular taxi) 9:20 Arrive at No.2 rice paddy art site (there is a wait time when crowded) 10:00 Arrive at No.1 rice paddy art site (there is a wait time when crowded) 10:30 Tour Katana no Iori (Japanese sword workshop) and actually handle a Japanese sword 12:00 Lunch of local dishes at a farmhouse restaurant; Japanese meals are prepared from vegetables freshly picked that day from the restaurant's backyard garden 13:30 Arrive at Hirosaki Apple Park; tour Cider Factory Kimori in the park 14:45 Tour Hirosaki Castle in Hirosaki Park 15:30 Have a cup of coffee at a Starbucks housed in a cultural property *Participants are responsible for paying for their coffee 16:15 Tour Niji no Mart (popular local market) and shop 17:00 Arrive at main entrance to Hirosaki Station; walk over to Ishiba Ryokan 17:15 Check-in to Ishiba Ryokan; enjoy the inn experience at your leisure until checkout Day 2 Check-out
strTitle: 2-Day Tour in Tsugaru, Aomori: Enchantments of Hirosaki

strIntroduction: When you think of Aomori prefecture, apples come to mind! Hirosaki Apple Park has approximately 65 types of apples and 1,300 apple trees. In the fall, you can try apple picking. Cider Factory Kimori, located in the park, lets you try refreshing cider that tastes as if it was pressed straight from an apple (separate fee required). Hirosaki Castle has a history of over 400 years. Today, it is in the midst of being moved, so you can see the castle without its stone-wall base, something seen only once in 100 years. At the Zenringai district, which has a strong historical relationship with Hirosaki Castle, you can also experience Zen meditation. Your spirit will be refreshed. After eating the popular local ramen, sit down with a cup of coffee at an unusual Starbucks housed in a cultural property (coffee is a separate fee). This tour lets you fully experience the enchantment of both Aomori's past and present! The tour ends at an early hour so that afterwards you can readily travel to Oirase Keiryu (mountain stream).Spend a languid time eating meals made from whole Aomori apples and bathing in a bath overlooking the grand nature of Oirase. Schedule: Day 1 8:30 Gather at Joto Exit, Hirosaki Station; meet up with the guide and travel to Hirosaki Apple Park in a vehicle (van or regular taxi) 9:00 Arrive at Hirosaki Apple Park; tour Cider Factory Kimori in the park 10:15 Tour Hirosaki Castle in Hirosaki Park 11:00 Experience Zen meditation at Zenringai, where there are 33 temples, all of the Soto school of Zen 12:00 Eat lunch at a local popular ramen shop, Niboshi Chuka 12:40 Have a cup of coffee at a Starbucks housed in a cultural property *Participants are responsible for paying for their coffee 13:20 Arrive at main entrance to Hirosaki Station; end tour 13:26 Depart from main entrance to Hirosaki Station; take a bus to Aomori Airport (out-of-pocket cost of 1000 yen per person) 14:20 Arrive at Aomori Airport 15:00 Depart on free shuttle bus to Oirase Keiryu 16:30 Arrive at Oirase Keiryu Hotel 18:00 Dinner at Aomori Ringo Kitchen 21:00 Attend a lecture on nature in the vicinity by Mori no Gakko, which teaches the value of Oirase Keiryu Day 2 7:00 Breakfast buffet 8:00 Take a free shuttle bus; walk along the mountain stream 10:00 Depart from Oirase Keiryu Hotel; ride the shuttle bus
strTitle: 2-Day Tour in Tsugaru, Aomori: Hirosaki's past and present

strIntroduction: The rice paddy art in Inakadate has become famous worldwide. The theme for this year's art is ""Godzilla Resurgence"" and ""Sanadamaru,"" the NHK historical drama. The art that uses land as a canvas constantly changes and is a must see while it lasts! There is also a tour of the workshop run by the sword smith, Mitsugu Nakahata who has crafted Japanese swords for many years in Inakadate. While listening to explanations from the sword smith, you can take a sword in hand for a close look. A lunch featuring local foods will be prepared. Enjoy a leisurely lunch at a farmhouse restaurant that doesn't' have a menu--it serves whatever has been freshly picked that day. The tour ends at an early hour so that afterwards you can readily travel to Oirase Keiryu (mountain stream). Spend a languid time eating meals made from whole Aomori apples and bathing in a bath overlooking the grand nature of Oirase. Schedule: Day 1 8:30 Gather at Joto Exit, Hirosaki Station; meet up with the guide and travel to Inakadate in a vehicle (van or regular taxi) 9:00 Arrive at No.2 rice paddy art site (there is a wait time when crowded) 9:40 Arrive at No.1 rice paddy art site (there is a wait time when crowded) 10:15 Tour Katana no Iori (Japanese sword workshop) and actually handle a Japanese sword 11:40 Lunch of local dishes at a farmhouse restaurant; Japanese meals are prepared from vegetables freshly picked that day from the restaurant's backyard garden 12:50 Tour Niji no Mart (popular local market) and shop *Go to roadside station on Sundays. 13:15 Arrive at main entrance to Hirosaki Station; end tour 13:26 Depart from main entrance to Hirosaki Station; take a bus to Aomori Airport (out-of-pocket cost of 1000 yen per person) 14:20 Arrive at Aomori Airport 15:00 Depart on free shuttle bus to Oirase Keiryu 16:30 Arrive at Oirase Keiryu Hotel 18:00 Dinner at Aomori Ringo Kitchen 21:00 Attend a lecture on nature in the vicinity by Mori no Gakko, which teaches the value of Oirase Keiryu Day 2 7:00 Breakfast buffet 8:00 Take a free shuttle bus; walk along the mountain stream 10:00 Depart from Oirase Keiryu Hotel; ride the shuttle bus
strTitle: 2-Day Tour in Aomori: Rice Paddy Art and Japanese Swords

strIntroduction: The Aizu 33 Kannon pilgrimage has been designated a Japanese Heritage. Among the many temples, it is said that visiting the popular Aizu Korori San Kannon (three temples in Aizu that enshrine the Kannon Goddess of Mercy) will bring blessings. A reserved vehicle is used so you can depart when you like and make efficient use of time, and a volunteer guide will accompany you for a stress-free tour. After enjoying sightseeing, visit Aizu Higashiyama Onsen that has been loved by locals for 1300 years. You can enjoy delicious food at a hot spring inn and soothe away fatigue from your travels in the bath. Schedule: Day 1 13:00 Gather at Aizu-Wakamatsu Station; visit the Buddhist city of Aizu and Aizu Korori San Kannon (Nakata Kannon, Tachiki Kannon, and Torioi Kannon) 16:30 Check-in to the hot springs inn, Harataki; freely relax and enjoy the hot springs baths and dinner Day 2 Checkout at your convenience; tour Aizu at your leisure. Note that the price depends on the season: Price A (4/1–4/15,1/4–3/31) Price B (4/16-4/30,5/5-7/31,8/26-10/7,11/13,12/28) Price C (8/1-8/11,8/16-8/25,10/8-11/12,12/29,12/30,1/3) Price D (5/1-5/4,8/12-8/15) Price E (12/31-1/2) Please book the correct price from the menu list.
strTitle: 2-Day Tour in Aizu: Visit Aizu Korori San Kannon &hot spring

strIntroduction: This is a 2-day tour to Aizu which focuses on the traditional culture of Japanese lacquer. You are given the unusual opportunity to meet craftsmen, and can also see a tree farm from which the raw wood is taken to make lacquer. Visitors can learn all about the backdrop that gave rise to this traditional Japanese culture, and purchase lacquerware pieces while gaining advice from locals. A special guide will accompany you who is well-versed in lacquerware so you can feel at ease during the tour. Schedule: Day 1 13:00 Gather at Aizu-Wakamatsu Station 13:00–16:00 Experience lacquerware, a traditional craft of Aizu; tour a lacquer tree farm and lacquerware workshop 16:00 Arrive at Aizu-Wakamatsu Station; check-in to Ekimae Fuji Grand Hotel Day 2 Checkout at your convenience; tour Aizu at your leisure
strTitle: 2-Day Tour in Aizu: Experience Japanese lacquer culture

strIntroduction: This is a 2-day tour that will take you to Aizu's hot springs and Ouchijuku village. Schedule: Day 1 11:30 Gather at Aizu-Wakamatsu Station 12:30–14:25 Visit Ouchi-juku 14:40–15:00 Visit Yunokami Onsen Station (experience the foot bath) 15:10–16:00 Visit To-no-Hetsuri 16:20 Arrive at Ashinomaki Onsen, ""Okawaso""; check-in Day 2 10:00 Checkout; take the hotel shuttle bus 10:50 Arrive at Aizu-Wakamatsu Station; tour Aizu at your leisure (Nanukamachi, Mt. Iimori, etc.)
strTitle: 2-Day Tour in Aizu: Enjoy Ouchijuku village and hot springs

strIntroduction: This is a 2-day tour to Aizu's local hot springs and history spots. Schedule: Day 1 11:15 Gather at Aizu-Wakamatsu Station 11:30 Board the local sightseeing bus with a volunteer guide and visit Tsuruga Castle, Miyaizumi Brewery, a samurai residence, and Mt. Iimori 15:37 Arrive at Higashiyama Onsen Station; take a shuttle bus 15:40 Check-in to the hot springs inn, Harataki; freely relax and enjoy the hot springs baths and dinner Day 2 Checkout at your convenience after breakfast and utilize the local sightseeing bus to take a tour of Aizu at your leisure (Nanukamachi, Mt. Iimori, etc.) Note that prices differ by season: Price A (4/1–4/15,1/4–3/31) Price B (4/16-4/30,5/5-7/31,8/26-10/7,11/13,12/28) Price C (8/1-8/11,8/16-8/25,10/8-11/12,12/29,12/30,1/3) Price D (5/1-5/4,8/12-8/15) Price E (12/31-1/2) Please pick the correct price from the menu list. All prices are per person.
strTitle: 2-Day Tour in Aizu: Learn history and enjoy hot springs

strIntroduction: The place you will be visiting is Machida in Tokyo and it is known for its unique mixture of city and countryside. You will meet up at the local tour provider's office that is about a 10-minute walk from the Harajuku Station at 1:00 pm and move to the destination by car. It will be around 1-hour drive from the office to the destination. Once you arrive at Machida, a local host who reside there will be your guide for the day. The number of participants is limited to 8 people, so that hospitable service is ensured for each participant. There will be a translator to help you communicate with the locals. You will spend around 3 to 4 hours exploring the area and doing some activities that locals do in Machida. You will also get the chance to sit down with a local and ask him any questions you may have about their lives. This trip allows you to discover the real life in Japan by connecting with locals and diving into their life. After the tour, you will head back to Harajuku Station to get back to the bustling city life. *Don't forget On this tour, you will explore deep in the woods! So be aware to wear long pants and sleeves that can get dirty!
strTitle: Hike and Explore Japan's Nature Trails near Tokyo

strIntroduction: The tour will start from a vineyard-walking and tasting at its stone-build cellar Sadoya, one of the oldest winery in Japan with. We will move to Shosenkyo Gorge and have traditional noodle “Hoto” for lunch in Shosenkyo Hoto Building. We will then take a trail of the wild nature in Shousenkyo Gorge, Chichibu Tama National Park. Feel and relax in the tranquility at Erinji Temple which was designed by Zen giant monk Muso Soseki in the 14th century, also well known as a family temple of famous feudal lord Takeda Shingen. 8:00 Meet and pick up at your requested location in Tokyo 10:00 Sadoya winery Sadoya was founded in 1874 and has been operated through generations. Their wines are highly acclaimed, especially the flagship wine “Muscut Bailey A Barrel Aged” was awarded Silver Medal by Decanter Magazine World Wine Award (UK) 2016. You can walk in the pretty vineyard, go through the stone-build cellar and finally are treated with free tasting! 11:30 Shosenkyo Gorge (lunch) Shosenkyo is said to be the most beautiful gorge in Japan. You can enjoy the wonderful nature every season. Along the trail, you will be astonished to see the odd shape of granite cliffs and a 30 m height waterfall. The highlight is going to be the panoramic view with the Mt. Fuji from the top of the mountain where you can access by the cable car. 14:30 Erinji Temple Erinji Temple was designed by famous Zen monk Muso Soseki, same as Tenryuji Temple in Kyoto and Engakuji Temple in Kamakura. You may enjoy the beautiful view of the Japanese garden. If you are interested in Zazen meditation, you can join one hour session held every 2nd Sunday of the month (*optional). This is also a family temple of Takeda Shingen who was one of the greatest warrior during the warring state in the 16th century. 16:30 Onsen Hot Springs We can have a relaxing time and at an onsen (hot springs) before returning to Tokyo (*optional). 19:30 Drop-off at your requested location in Tokyo
strTitle: Private tour to Sadoya winery, Shosenkyo & Erinji Zen temple

strIntroduction: Gather at Toyama Exit of JR Takadanobaba Station and walk to Shinjuku Sports Centre. Change your cloths to Aikidogi (Aikido uniform) or sports wear and warm-up. Listen to a short lecture of Aikido and learn the concept of it. Learn how to protect yourself, using Aikido techniques, trying to move like people who practice Budo.
strTitle: Try Aikido, a Wonderful Japanese Traditional Martial Art

strIntroduction: Learn to make sushi from a professional chef in Tsukiji, site of the world’s largest fish market. During this 2-hour workshop you’ll gain experience cutting fresh, raw fish and learn the art of rolling "maki" (sushi rolls) with a sheet of seaweed and sushi rice. Afterward, savor your creations made with several types of fish, depending on the day’s catch. Once you arrive to the designated venue, you can get ready for an authentic sushi experience. You will cut sushi, roll maki and learn about the art of sushi-making from a professional. First, you will learn how to prepare the fish. You will get raw fish to cut and be instructed on how to do so. You will prepare Maguro (tuna), Ikura (salmon roe) and three or four other kinds of fish, depending on the catch of the day. You can be assured that the fish that you will be using, will be of a high-quality. You will then be given a big container of sushi rice from which you will make small rice balls to be the base of the sushi. Later, you will put the raw fish and rice together to make the sushi. You will also be using real wasabi root that you will grind yourself! You will also be taught how to make maki, or sushi rolls. At the end of the class, you will be able to try what you have created.
strTitle: Enjoy Sushi Making Class with a Professional Chef in Tsukiji

strIntroduction: Learn all there is to know about sake, Japan's beloved alcoholic beverage, on this day tour. Get taken on a journey to some of Nagano Prefecture’s sake breweries and become familiar with the brewing process and the cultural importance of sake. Your day begins in Yudanaka with a visit to Yamanouchi’s own sake brewery, Tamamura, a place with over 200 years of history. Learn the basics on how to make the rice wine and get invited into tasting some of the specialty sake. After finishing your drink, you will be led back to Yudanaka Station where lunch and a tasting of local sake at Goen will be waiting for you. With your lunch and first set of sake tasting behind you, the guide will take you on the train to Obuse where two more sake breweries are introduced to you. Obuse is a town famous for its chestnut confectionery and for being the beloved town of Katsushika Hokusai, the ukiyo-e painter best known for his “Thirty-six Views of Mount Fuji.” You will have free time to wander around the old town and buy the chestnut ice cream or confectioneries if you’re feeling up for something sweet after all the sake. After stopping by Obuse, make your way to Nagano City where one more tasting of Japan’s national drink will be waiting for you. At the end of the day, you will be able to call yourself a master of sake tasting. One thing is for sure: you will get your fill of sake on this day tour. Tour itinerary: 11:00 Meet up in front of the Yudanaka Station and leave for the first sake brewery. 12:00 Get back at Yudanaka Station and enjoy a lunch at GOEN. 13:15 Leave for Obuse where two more sake breweries will be visited. 15:00 Enjoy wandering around Obuse in free time after visiting the two Obuse breweries. 15:45 Leave for Nagano City where you will be introduced to the last brewery of the tour. 17:30 End of the tour.
strTitle: Take a One Day Tour to Nagano's Sake Breweries

strIntroduction: Obuse is a small town in northern Nagano Prefecture where you can still feel the atmosphere of Japan’s Edo Period. Obuse is famous as the town where Hokusai Katsushika, the world-famous Japanese artist known for his "Thirty-six Views of Mt Fuji" masterpieces and for various other ukiyo-e paintings, spent the last years of his life. Many of the town’s highlights are related to his work and to the work of his patron, Kozan Takai, the man who accommodated Hokusai during his stay in Obuse. The town has developed into a major tourist destination in the region. On this Obuse tour, you will cycle approximately 11.8 miles (19km) from Yudanaka Station, the nearest train station to the Jigokudani Monkey Park, to Obuse. On the way down, you will stop by some cultural spots and go past farmland areas to provide insight into local culture. The entire cycle is about 2.5 hours of downhill or flat paved paths. After reaching the town of Obuse, a lunch made of Obuse’s specialty, chestnuts, will be served. Lunch is followed by an introduction of the town and some of its major sightseeing attractions, such as the Gansho-in Temple, historic streets, and famous sake breweries. The tour concludes at the Obuse train station, where you can either go back to Yudanaka Station or head for Nagano Station. Tour itinerary: 10:00 Meet/registration at GOEN, the restaurant located in front of Yudanaka Station. 10:15 The cycling tour begins. We will cycle to some historical and cultural sites while enjoying the countryside and natural scenery. We will tell you all you want to know about local culture. 12:45 Arrival at the Gansho-in Temple, the backdoor of Obuse Town. Here you will be shown Hokusai's last masterpiece, a legendary bird drawn on a ceiling as big as 21 tatami mats. 13:30 Head to the central area of the Obuse Town to enjoy a delicious local lunch. 14:45 A brief walking tour will give you an introduction of the town. 15:15 Here you can enjoy free-time at the Obuse town. There are many museums, souvenir shops, sake breweries, cafes, etc. to be explored. 16:25 Gather at the meeting point, then head to the Obuse train station. 16:30 The tour concludes at Obuse station. The train to Yudanaka departs at 16:42 and the train to Nagano departs at 16:54.
strTitle: Join Obuse Cycling & Sightseeing Day Tour, Nagano

strIntroduction: The tour starts at 10am at the Japanese restaurant Goen, found in front of Yudanaka Station. Take a walk through a hillside path where you can absorb the beautiful nature Japan has to offer. After the forest walk you will arrive at Shibu Onsen where you can soak up the history and scenery of the historic hot spring town. The walk continues past the river and some panoramic views and concludes at the Jigokudani Monkey Park. The Jigokudani Monkey Park is famous for its monkeys, as they are the only monkeys known to mankind that bathe in a hot spring. The monkeys don't enter the baths as much during the green season, but they are still lovely to see with their new-born babies. After the monkey park, you head back down the mountain via a different route to a delicious little restaurant for lunch. Tour itinerary: 10:00 Start/registration at GOEN, in front of Yudanaka Station - Head on a forest trail for around 30 minutes to the statue of Heiwa Kannon - Go to Shibu Onsen, learn about its history and stories, and you can challenge yourself to eating an onsen egg. - HIke for 30 minutes towards the Jigokudani Monkey Park while learning about the area and its inhabitants. 12:00 Spend about an hour at the Jigokudani Monkey Park. 13:30 Hike back down a different route. 13:30 Enjoy a delicious lunch at ENZA Cafe. 14:30 Take up the bicycle and start the cycling part! 16:00 Return at Yudanaka Station / / Finish Lunch is followed by a cycle through the Yamanouchi countryside past rice paddies, rivers and fruit orchards. The tour concludes at Yudanaka Station where you can choose to relax your tired feet in a free hot foot bath, relax at the restaurant Goen, or simply head back to Nagano by train.
strTitle: Join Snow Monkey Walking & Cycling Day Tour in Nagano

strIntroduction: See the famous Japanese Macaques and hike up to the Shiga-kogen Highlands on this guided day tour. The day starts with the meet-up at Nagano Station. From there, your guide will take you to the entrance of the Jigokudani Monkey Park and lead you to where the monkeys are be roaming around. These monkeys are famous all over the world for their tendency to bathe in the hot springs found at the park. The guide will tell you all of the facts and features that you would want to know about the fuzzy creatures. After some quality time with the snow monkeys, the guide will take you to a restaurant close to the park entrance where you can rest your feet and enjoy a Japanese lunch. After recouping your energy with lunch, the hike to the Shiga-kogen Highlands starts. You will hike 2.8 miles (4.0 km) up the Shiga-kogen Highlands to an altitude of 4900 feet (1500 m). Here, you can see the mountainous area where the snow monkeys and many other of Japanese indigenous animals reside. A knowledgeable guide will walk you through the various flora and fauna to be seen as you walk past the 33 Buddhist Kannon statues that have the function of protecting travelers passing by. The Shiga-kogen Highlands is one of the most famous ski resorts in Japan, and was the setting for the 1998 Winter Olympics. It has more ski slopes than one can count. During the summer, however, the vast highlands are revealed in their green glory. On this hike, you will walk to the tallest waterfall of the Shiga-kogen Highlands and go past several of the famous lakes of the Shiga area. The hike ends near Hasuike lake where you can see one of the biggest ski slopes in the area. From here, the guide will lead you back to Yudanaka Station where you can enjoy the onsen bath located next to the station. The hike to the Monkey Park and Shiga-kogen has impressive sights and scenery, whether it is cloudy or sunny. Be prepared though; the tracks are quite narrow and could be muddy. Good hiking shoes are highly advised! Tour itinerary: 8:45 Gather at the Shinkansen exit of Nagano Station. Our staff will be there by 8:30am. 11:00 Wander around the Jigokudani Monkey Park. 12:15 Have a lunch at the restaurant nearby the Jigokudani Monkey Park entrance. 13:00 Start the hike up to the Shiga-kogen Highlands. 15:30 Take a break with the backdrop of the tallest waterfall of the Shiga Highlands. 16:15 Arrival at the Biwaike Lake and walk the trail around. 17:00 Arrival at the Hasuike Lake and enjoy the view of a highland's ski resort. Take the bus back to Yudanaka. 17:35 Arrival at Yudanaka Station. A train back to Nagano Station leaves Yudanaka at 17:50 (or 18:20) and arrives at Nagano at 18:59 (or 19:24).
strTitle: 1-Day Snow Monkey and Shiga-kogen Highlands Hiking Tour

strIntroduction: This is a tour around local places near Mt Fuji! Itinerary: 9:00 a.m. - Depart from Mishima Station If you cannot come to Mishima by Shinkansen, I'll come to pick you up at Tokyo Station by Shinkansen. Please feel free to contact me. NOTE: The Shinkansen ticket fee is *not* included in the tour price. - Oshino Hakkai (60 min) Take pictures with Mt.Fuji. Drink pure and clean water springing from Mt.Fuji. Shopping (you can enjoy a variety of things made in this area, such as vegetable pickles, miso, and fish-paste products) - Unique shopping around Lake Kawaguchi (60 min) Take pictures with Mt.Fuji. Unique Shopping (you can purchase a lot of unique things such as T-shirts and lanterns printed with images of Mt. Fuji) - Lunch (60 min) Enjoy Robata, a way of grilling fresh ingredients in an old traditional restaurant. You can grill and eat vegetables and meats which local people grow and harvest here by yourself. - You can go back to the past. I'll take you to 40-year-old Japanese traditional villages at Lake Saiko. (60 min) If you have any requests or questions, please don't hesitate to ask. I am looking forward to meeting you! ※ If you are lucky, you can see the beautiful Mt.Fuji. It depends on the weather whether you can see the beautiful Mt. Fuji. But even if you can't see it well, you can enjoy many things in the area. - Return to Mishima station Return from Mishima to Tokyo for one hour by Shinkansen This course will take about 6 hours to get around. Note: Robata-yaki, or simply robata, is a method of grilling fresh ingredients over hot charcoal. It is often called the Japanese barbecue.
strTitle: Experience eating "Robata-yaki" barbecue near Mt. Fuji

strIntroduction: This is a 4.5 hour walking tour in which you can experience local areas in Tokyo. You will see the following highlights: 1. Gokokuji Temple, founded in 1681. Kannon-do and Gekko-do are important cultural properties. 2. The old missionary in Zoushigaya was the house of American missionary 3. Zoushigaya cemetery is one of the three largest cemeteries in Tokyo. 4. Hall dedicated to Kishimojin, famous for being Goddess of easy delivery. 5. Sunshine City in Ikebukuro, which has theme parks, for example: - Namja Town: Indoor type theme park that has 13 attractions with food Pick-up at your hotel, or meet at Gokokuji subway station (Yurakucho line), at 13:00 pm.
strTitle: Walk through the Zoushigaya area to Ikebukuro Sunshine City

strIntroduction: During this tour, you can visit "must see" places in Sapporo. Sapporo is the capital city in Hokkaido and there are a lot of attractions for tourists. I will guide you through most of the famous touristic sites at first. These include Hitsujigaoka Observation Hill, the Odori park, the Clock Tower and more. As for your lunch and dinner I will guide you to famous local restaurants not known to tourists. You can eat Sapporo ramen or "Ghenghis Khan", a local type of mutton BBQ. Then, upon your requests I will take you to a local Izakaya (Japanese style tavern) after dinner in Susukino area. Let's enjoy drinking together (to go to Susukino area after dinner, you don't need to pay extra fee for your guide).
strTitle: Enjoy Sapporo and try Sapporo ramen and mutton BBQ!

strIntroduction: As a main port, Otaru city was developed as an international city. During this tour, you can see Japanese and Western mixed historical buildings at the canal area and Sakaimachi district and you can also visit the famous Herring Palace. You can also enjoy riding a rickshaw and discover the formerly prospering financial area at the so called ”Otaru wall district” Then, you can enjoy some local special snacks including fresh seafood BBQ and Japanese Osenbei rice crackers at Sakaimachi district. Besides, you will experience glass bead making as well. I am looking forward to seeing you on this tour!
strTitle: Find historical assets and try fresh seafood in Otaru

strIntroduction: Stroll through Ethnic Town in Tokyo, feeling and seeing real international atmosphere on a 2-hour tour. After gathering at the ticket gate of JR Shin-Okubo Station, you will first walk to Islamic Alley, where you can find Nepali restaurant, shop and see a mosque in a building. Stroll through the biggest and most popular Korean Town in Japan to see so many K-Pop shops, Korean restaurants and souvenir shops, and the so-called "Ikemen-dori" (Handsome Street). Also visit Koizumi Yakumo Memorial Park and go to see Okubo Elementary School, where you can find notices in several languages. Visit one of the biggest Thai supermarket "Asia Superstore" and look for what you want or just relax. Visit Shinjuku Multicultural Plaza in Kabukicho and find how foreign people try to live in Japan. You can find free Japanese classes, and staff will try their best to provide you with any kind of information about Japan. This is the final destination of this tour, and it is possible to take you to Shinjuku Station, taking less than 10 minutes by walk. You can stop and buy whatever you want during this tour.
strTitle: Enjoy a Shin-Okubo Ethnic Town Tour, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Tosenkyo, a fan tossing game, started in the Edo period. It is originally from China. Geisha and Maiko in Kyoto played the game back in the days with their customers. The fame can be played from 11 am to 10 pm on Monday to Friday. Or 5 pm to 10 pm on Saturday. Please contact us if about availability. The game will take about 30 minutes. For lunch we will serve Shokado Bento, which is a typical Japanese meal. For dinner we will serve Kaiseki meal, in which you'll enjoy the season's best food in Japan. Both can be served in a vegetarian or Halal version.
strTitle: Play fan tossing game "tousenkyo" and eat Japanese dishes!

strIntroduction: Rent a costume at this photo studio for cosplayers in Akihabara, a popular place for Japanese anime culture. You can choose a Japanese costume of any kind such as ninja, maid, shrine maiden, yukata, anime costumes and many more! When you have made your choice let your Japanese cosplayer staff put the character make up on your face so that you can feel like you're living in an anime world. After that you'll have pictures taken of you in costume, and get a Polaroid picture to take away as a souvenir that will remind you of this unique experience in Japan! You can even get the digital image as well! Then, in your costume, head out to the Tokyo district of Akihabara, also known as the home of anime culture and take a walk there. You can also check out the nearby shrine and other fun places that Akihabara has to offer. When you're done with touring Akihabara, change back into your own clothes and select your favorite pictures from the photoshoot.
strTitle: Enjoy Cosplay with Full Make-Up in Akihabara

strIntroduction: You will start your half-day tour at the JR Saga Arashiyama Station. The Arashiyama district, located west of the Kyoto city center, has long been a scenic leisure spot. Many ancient aristocrats had their villas here a thousand years ago and enjoyed creating literature and poetry. Today, the area is one of the most popular tourist sites in Kyoto. At first you will visit the Togetsukyo Bridge which, as the area’s landmark, dates back to the 9th century and provides a good photo opportunity for visitors. It is a very beautiful and traditional bridge. While walking, you will try Yuba soup, rice crackers, fried Yuba cake and Leek pancake. You will then visit the Tenryuji temple which was built in 1339 by the Shogun Ashikaga in memory of the Emperor Go-Daigo and was a complex of more than 100 buildings. They were mostly destroyed by fires and civil wars over the years, but the traditional garden remains in its original form, designed by the monk Muso Soseki. You can enjoy walking in the landscaped garden. From there, you will reach the bamboo grove that is native only to Japan and is a great photo opportunity. Here, you will enjoy walking in the bamboo grove, and then head for the Sagano area which has a historical significance with many beautiful temples. While walking, you will have Japanese sweets as well.
strTitle: Enjoy a Kyoto Food and Drink Tour in Arashiyama

strIntroduction: This is a Japanese cooking class in Kawagoe city, Saitama prefecture (just 30 minutes away from Tokyo). A small tour around Kawagoe will be included! Participants: min: 1 max: 6 For more participants, please ask. Place Community center near Kawagoe Station. I will take you there from the station. Timetable: ・pick up at the station 9:50 - Meet at Kawagoe Station → go to the kitchen in the community center. ・In the kitchen: 10:00 - briefing 10:10 - overview of Japanese food 10:20 - cooking - demonstration and hands on cooking 12:00 – lunch time ・in Kuradori street in Kawagoe (Optional tour) 13:00 - Take a stroll through the Kawagoe main street, see old castle, temples and shrines. ・About Kawagoe Kawagoe is located about 30 minutes by train from Tokyo. The main street Kuradori retains traditional and old buildings from the Edo Period (1603-1867). There are so many historical places around: castles, temples, shrines, old merchant buildings, historical sweets, merchant street and museums.
strTitle: Enjoy a cooking class with a small tour in ancient Kawagoe

strIntroduction: This is a 2.5-hour tour to the old areas of Yanaka and Nippori. Itinerary: Meet outside the North Gate of Nippori Station. Go to a temple and see Buddha. There are many graves around the temples, so we will talk about temples and graves in Japan. Visit museums of traditional architecture. You can understand about Japanese people's lives in the old days. At the museum of public bath, we will see the building and exhibition inside but not bathe. Take a break at a tea house. You can enjoy the atmosphere of a traditional tea house. Try some snacks like rice cracker. Look around some shops: typical crafts, food and green tea. Pass through a traditional shopping mall and go back to the Nippori Station. * Depending on the place you go next, we can guide you to the most convenient place or station.
strTitle: Explore traditional cultures in Yanaka and Nippori, Tokyo

strIntroduction: We offer Kyoto-style home dish cooking in English! *or with English translator, depending on the availability of the instructors Course Detail: Contents/Recipe: Recipe A Sukiyaki Course Dashi tasting : Learn about Dashi, which is a basis of Japanese food. Dashi-maki Tamago (Japanese egg roll) : Cook simple side dish by using the Dashi and eggs. Special Sukiyaki: The traditional menu that has 400 years’ history in Japan, or commonly known as "Japanese Beef Hot Pot". Rice: the primary staple food of Japanese cuisines, which has long history in Japanese Culture. Mochi dessert: The sweets loved by many Japanese from old days. Matcha: Powdered-green tea. Let’s try making matcha tea and drink with Mochi dessert. Recipe B Temari-Sushi (Ball-Shaped Sushi) Course Special Price Campaign for New Course! Dashi tasting ：Learn about DASHI, which is a basis of Japanese food. Dashi-maki Tamago(Japanese egg roll)：Cook simple side dish by using the DASHI and eggs. Temari-Sushi: One type of sushi, Japan’s representative dish, with 700 years of history. Temari was initially made to be small and round so that it is easy for Maiko (apprentice Geishain Kyoto) to eat. It is made by putting a seafood topping of your preference on a vinegared rice. Date: every Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday Time: 4:00 P.M - 6:30 P.M. Number of Participants: 2 - 8 people *We also offer private lessons, where you are free to choose the time, date, and menu of your choice. As we are located in the middle of Kyoto City, close to Nishiki Market, it is conveniently accessible within from Kyoto City Subway and Hankyu Railway. Only 3 minutes from either station! SUMAYA Cooking Class was originally founded as a restaurant 80 years ago in Kyoto City center. It delivered high quality Japanese dishes to famous temples and companies, thus it has been much loved by the locals for several decades. Today, the 4th owner holds Japanese home cooking class. The authentic, traditional dishes are arranged to be easier so that everyone can learn easily. Here, we aim to teach and pass on the the charm of Japanese Cuisine, "washoku", not only to the locals but also to the world. Spread the passion and love for Japanese cuisine with us!
strTitle: Learn Kyoto Family Dishes, Cooking Class in Kyoto City
