strTitle: Reservation Service for Hotels in Japan

strIntroduction: Rice is a staple food in Japan and the Japanese have been creating a variety of preserved foods in order to enjoy rice, including “tsukemono” or pickled vegetables, and “tsukudani” or simmered seafood, vegetables or seaweed in soy sauce. There are hundreds and hundreds of accompaniments for rice in Japan. Karashi-mentaiko is one of them. It is made from “tarako” or pollack roe, which is immersed in salty water, then seasoned with “tougarashi” or hot pepper. Spicy salty karashi-mentaiko goes so well with rice that many Japanese choose it as their favorite side dish. Even pasta is combined with this pollack roe delicacy. “karashi-mentai spaghetti” is one of the popular menus in restaurants and coffee shops. And drinkers enjoy mentaiko without rice when they sip on Japanese sake. Perhaps everybody in Japan loves this seafood product. Fukuoka in Kyushu is the home of karashi-mentaiko. It is said that karashi-mentaiko came from Korea and was adapted to the Japanese taste in Fukuoka. Now mentaiko is produced in many companies of Fukuoka and attains the position of regional food. It is sold everywhere not only in supermarkets, but also in train stations, and airports. Each company makes their own mentaiko, therefore there are a variety of tastes, colors and flavors. In this activity, you can eat five varieties of karashi-mentaiko with rice and miso soup. You are able to compare the tastes and choose your favorite and the host at Suito Fukuoka will give you great tips on how to enjoy mentaiko. It is great to eat this great side dish in its birth place as mentaiko in Fukuoka is fresh and tender. Suito Fukuoka is a place for tourists who want to learn about the traditional food and culture in Kyushu. Discover things you don’t know at Suito Fukuoka! ●The activity is available from Tuesday to Sunday at the following time. Start from 11:00-/ 12:00-/ 13:00 *Please specify your preferred date and time when making reservation.
strTitle: Taste Karashi-Mentaiko in Fukuoka, Kyushu!

strIntroduction: Japanese sake, or rice wine is now gaining popularity all over the world. Sake goes very well with Japanese dishes as well as Chinese, Italian and French foods. A wide variety of sake has been produced in Japan. About 1,600 breweries exist and there are more than 20,000 brands of sake! The taste of sake varies with water, rice, and the climate which is why the location of breweries deeply affect the flavors and aroma of Japanese traditional beverages. For someone new to drinking sake there is the problem that there are too many sake varieties which will lead to confuse about which sake to choose at restaurants or liquor shops. However, Suito Fukuoka offers a great experience for sake tasting and an introduction to Japanese Sake. First of in this activity you will taste five varieties of sake after seeing their labels and you will remember each flavor and aroma. After that you will try blind tasting guess on the variety. Throughout this experience you will get to know which type of tastes you like, dry sake (“karakuchi”) or sweet sake (“amakuchi”), and what kind of sake goes well with intensely flavored dishes or lightly salted ones. Fukuoka is well-known for producing good “Shochu” or distilled spirit (another traditional alcohol in Japan), and there are many brands of sake awarded gold medals in sake competitions. The host at Suito Fukuoka will introduce sake made in Fukuoka and give you great tips on how to enjoy these traditional Japanese alcohols. Learn about the history and techniques for brewing sake! The activity is available from Tuesday to Sunday from the following time. Start from 13:00-/ 14:00-/ 15:00 *Please specify your preferred date and time when making reservation.
strTitle: Enjoy a Blind Tasting of Rice Wine and Sake in Fukuoka!

strIntroduction: The Akita region is not a hot spot like the conventional Japanese tourist areas. Yet because of that it gives you a glimpse into the traditional Japanese country life and what 'real' Japan is like! This northern, mountainous region is known for its beautiful landscapes, hot springs, and rich history. The Akita Shore Excursion car tour will allow you to experience all of this while relaxing! The car tour is comfortable and reliable, so all you have to do is sit back and relax! The local guides will teach you about the culture and historical background of the region, so it's no doubt you will come out of this tour well educated on the Akita region! To avoid disappointment, its best to reserve your desired dates as soon as possible! You will visit some of Akita's highlights such as the samurai city Kakunodate, known for its old samurai and merchant residences, as well as with its hundreds of willow cherry blossoms. You will also visit the tranquil legendary Lake Tazawa and hear about its spectacular story. Enjoy this one day tour to Akita's countryside!
strTitle: Shore Excursion from Akita to Kakunodate and Lake Tazawa

strIntroduction: This exciting excursion takes in some of the top sightseeing spots in the Tokushima area. First, visit the summit of Mt Bizan, the symbol of Tokushima City which overlooks the whole area. On clear days you can see as far as Awaji Island and the Kii Peninsula. Afterwards, visit the historic Tokushima Castle Museum, located in a picturesque garden within the ruins of Tokushima Castle. Next, visit Awa Jūrobe Yashiki Puppet Theatre at the former residence of a samurai who accepted being executed for a crime he didn't commit to preserve his master's reputation. Next visit Ohnaruto Bridge over the Naruto Strait to view the famous whirlpools, before the tour precedes to Ai no Yakata, a preserved traditional indigo dyeing factory. Try indigo dyeing yourself on any cloth item you have with you! Next, visit Awaodori Kaikan, where visitors can learn about Awa Odori dance and sample local products. Finally, visit Zuiganji Temple with its elegant gardens, carp filled pools, waterfall and delightful red pagoda. All excursions leave from and return to Tokushima Station, city hotels, and Tokushima Awa Odori Airport. Depending on the number of people on this excursion transportation will be by compact, mid-sized or jumbo taxi. Prices include guide and entrance fees where applicable.
strTitle: Shore Excursion in Tokushima and Naruto, Shikoku

strIntroduction: Enjoy some of the wonderful sights and locations of beautiful Shimane prefecture by private taxi. This tour includes a visit to Matsue Castle, known as the Black Castle, one of the last remaining feudal era castles in Japan. Marvel at the picturesque Yuushien Gardens with over 250 varieties of peonies, the delightful Ryuukeidaki waterfalls, the charming pond-side Ichibo Tea House, and three restaurants offering eel, Korean ginseng and other local dishes with seasonal ingredients. The Adachi Art Museum has a fine collection of modern Japanese art, including paintings by Taikan Yokoyama. The museum's garden is widely celebrated for its four seasons displays. Guide and entrance fees for the above are included in the excursion price. But that isn't all, the excursion also includes a visit to Mizuki Shigeru Road, a famous 800 meter shopping area lined with Yokai (monster) statues from the imagination of manga artist Shigeru Mizuki. For more shopping, you will visit the Aeon Mall Hiezu before the excursion ends in Yonago City. This excursion by compact, mid-sized or jumbo taxi departs from either Yonago Kitaro Airport, or Sakaiminato International Passenger (ferry) Terminal and takes approximately 7 hours. Prices include guide and entrance fees where applicable. This tour is available for everyday.
strTitle: Shore Excursion from Sakaiminato Port to Tottori and Matsue!

strIntroduction: At the top of the dining hierarchy in Japan is sushi. Sushi is the most famous Japanese dish outside of Japan and one of the most popular dishes among the Japanese themselves. In Japan, sushi is usually enjoyed on special occasions such as a celebration. However, many Japanese people have not experienced making sushi, instead they just eat sushi at sushi restaurants or buy sushi bento boxes. So this is an offer you can't refuse! A chance to experience making sushi yourself! East Inc. offers you a sushi making workshop in Fukuoka with classes held just 2-minutes walk from Hakata Station on the JR/Subway lines. And don’t worry! This class is suitable for complete beginners and there are two courses available with both held over 90 minutes. Course A: Includes making and tasting 3 types of nigirizushi x 2, a delicious tuna roll and a clear broth soup. Course B: Includes making and tasting 8 types of nigirizushi, a delicious tuna roll and a clear broth soup. Reception hours: Tuesday – Sunday 11:30 – /13:00 – Closed on Monday, and additionally twice a month.
strTitle: Learn How to Make Sushi in Fukuoka!

strIntroduction: Painting a Hakata doll is a special experience that you can do in Fukuoka! Hakata dolls are one of the most famous traditional handcrafts in Hakata and have a history of more than 400 years and is known for its rich facial expression and its rich variety. Recently, it has become popular as an interior decoration and as a souvenir for foreign visitors. With this experience, you can express your artistic side and decorate your own Hakata doll to your own tastes by creating an original Hakata doll! It will take 60 minutes to paint one doll and it is open every day from 09:00 to 18:00. You can either make a reservation by yourself or for group of up to 20 people.
strTitle: Enjoy Painting Hakata Dolls in Fukuoka

strIntroduction: Wearing a kimono is one of the most popular activities for tourist coming to Japan and can often be done in Kyoto, but now it is also available in Fukuoka prefecture! Traditionally kimono's have many layers, are very heavy and are made from expensive fabric, so many Japanese people don't have a kimono nor do they know how to wear it. So usually for kimono rentals the time wearing it will be very short and you can wont go outside, or at most, only for a short time! As a result, a lot of places offer Yukata experiences instead of Kimono experiences. However, “Suito Fukuoka” offers unique Kimono experiences where they use an easy to wear kimono called a “Wasomi” which you can wear just as you would wear western clothes. It's designer is a Kitsuke master, which means she is a master of the procedure and the skills required to wear kimono. She knew how difficult kimonos are to wear and wanted to help Japanese women and their daughters living overseas to be able to put on a kimono by themselves. The wasomi kimono was born after many years of research and trials and even though it is easy to wear, it still looks beautiful and distinctive as a kimono and not a yukata. The time for kitsuke is short, so you will have more time to take photos! *Option detail* 1. 60 minutes option Dress up experience, photoshoot with your own camera. 2. 4 hours option Dress up experience, 4 hours rental. 3. 3 hours option Dress up experience, hair styling, make up and a photoshoot by a professional photographer
strTitle: Enjoy easy Kimono experience in Fukuoka!

strIntroduction: Kushiro Shitsugen National park in Hokkaido opened in 1987 to preserve the diverse ecosystem in the largest wetland in Japan and a habitat for the beautiful White Red-Crested Japanese Crane. It is also well known that it was registered under the Ramsar Convention in 1980 as the first registration within Japan. Since then, Kushiro wetland has been spreading the importance and value of preservation domestically while also receiving a high evaluation from abroad. This exciting car tour is with experienced local driver who will drive to the 3 most popular observation points out of 5. Kushiro Shitsugen is so big that it covers the size of central of Tokyo and there are many ways to enjoy it, making this tour a highly recommend car plan to visit the Kushiro wetland making efficient use of your valuable time. The Kushiro wet tour 4 hours plan is as below: Hosooka viewpoint: It is located on the eastern edge of the park, especially famous for its great sunset view above the winding Kushiro river, marsh and mountain view. Kottaro Marsh Viewpoints: Here there are primeval images of the wetland and also great spots for bird watching and if you are lucky you might be able to see the Japanese crane. Kushiro City Marsh Observatory: The observatory is a great viewpoint overlooking the unique view of tussock. Kushiro City cranes Nature Park The Japanese crane can be seen here all year around.
strTitle: Shore Excursion to Kushiro, a Natural Wonderland in Hokkaido

strIntroduction: Have you ever tried Calligraphy, one of the most famous arts done in Japan? Japanese enjoy doing calligraphy in school and some people take lessons. At “SUiTO” you can experience calligraphy and even print it on t-shirt and take it home as a unique souvenir! “Suito” is taken from the Fukuokan dialect meaning “like” or “love” and the Fukuokan dialect has been chosen as the cutest dialect in Japan. “SUiTO” has two roles: the first one is to make foreigners visiting Fukuoka feel “Suito” by offering a traditional Japanese experience starting with the cultural heritage of the Kyushu area. The second role is to make residents able to confidently make recommendations on what they “suito” in their city. There are many experiences offered at “SUiTO,” one of which is printing calligraphy on a t-shirt. With this activity, you will learn how to write your favorite Japanese characters, kanji before printing it on a t-shirt. Of course you can make requests on what to write so that you can make your own original t-shirt! This experience will take 60 minutes and is open every day from 9:00 to 18:00. You can either make a reservation by yourself or for a group up to 20 people.
strTitle: Experience Calligraphy by Writing on a T-Shirt in Fukuoka

strIntroduction: This all-in tour to historic sites by car will teach you about the history, famous sightseeing places and the great nature of Kagoshima in just 5 easy and comfortable hours! The major sightseeing areas of Kagoshima can divide into four: Satsuma, Kirishima, Sakurajima and Osumi and this car tour will take you to 2 of those 4! Satsuma where there are a lot of historic sites and Sakurajima which is well known as an active volcano. Skillful local car conductor/drivers with expert knowledge of Kagoshima's sightseeing spots will give you an impressive experience and create a memory on this trip, offering you an enjoyable and fulfilling time. There are a wide range of car types available depending on the participants so you can join with friends and family, or as a couple. After enjoying the historic sightseeing spots the tour heads to Sakurajima Island by a popular ferry where you can try delicious Japanese noodles at a stand-up eating style restaurant. Once on Sakurajima Island the tour will visit its observatory where you can enjoy a magnificent view of the active volcano and the sea coast spread out below. From the observatory there may be the chance to hear eruptions from the volcanoes crater. This tour is great for those who want to visit and learn about the historic sites of Kagoshima while enjoying its magnificent scenery of rich nature and feel the thrill of an active volcano.
strTitle: Shore Excursion to the Must-See Spots of Kagoshima!

strIntroduction: This is a short trip to some of the highlights in the Eastern part of Tokyo! ★Kyu-Shiba Rikyu Gardens It is not just a Japanese garden, some local cultures are mixed there. Kyu-Shiba Rikyu Gardens was made in the Edo period. But why and what kind of people made it? What is the background of the local cultures? We'll introduce the history of Edo period and Japanese gardens. ★Zojoji Temple It is an important temple for the Tokugawa family. The large gate is also very important. What does the large gate mean? Learn about Buddhism and history in the Edo period. ★Tokyo Tower Tokyo tower is a symbolic tower in Tokyo. It is also a refined entertainment facility with opportunities for shopping, eating and leisure. ★Meeting place★ Hamamatsucho Station *Please come by 12:45 pm
strTitle: Stroll Kyu-Shiba Rikyu Gardens & Visit Tokyo Tower!

strIntroduction: Menu: - Temarizushi (ball sized sushi) made by seasonal fresh rare seafood. - Miso soup with Japanese broth - Side dish - Japanese style dessert You can learn: - How to cook Japanese homemade recipes - How to take Japanese broth and knowledge about several brothes - How to cook rice in traditional way - Wajima-nuri, the famous and traditional lacquered vessels - Basic table manner etc. This workshop is not private class. Please let me know the following info when you make the booking : - Name/Age/Gender/Nationality of each participants - Mail address - Hotel name - Contact phone number in Japan - Food restrictions or allergies (if you have) Policy for Muslims : All ingredients are Non-pork and Non-alcohol. In addition, some of seasonings are HALAL certified ones. Prayer space is available, but it's not special space. Cooking knife and cooking board are separated. Other cookwares and dishes are not separated whether HALAL or not. I am not Muslim, but I have enough knowledge about HALAL. If you have any anxious, please let me know in advance.
strTitle: Learn to cook homemade sushi with traditional items (HALAL)

strIntroduction: Mt. Takao has served as a sacred mountain since ancient times. According to the legends, the mountain is habitat of the Tengu, a long nosed goblin or demon and you will find many statutes of Tengu at the local temple. Tengu are believed to dwell on the sacred mountain acting as the messengers of the deities and Buddha to chastise evildoers and protect the good. It takes about 1 hour from Shinjuku Station by train to reach Mt Takao. There are several routes to climb Mt Takao and the most recommended route is Takao Station – the steepest cable car in the world to the mountain's mid-level – walk up to Yakuouin temple & the peak – lift down to the station. (5 hours in total) Stop at several power spots (spiritual spots), and pray for luck and money, passing examinations, protect from evil, fulfillment of wishes, marriage, happy family, long life, health, and so on. You can enjoy a wonderful view of Mt. Fuji, if the weather is good. Enjoy local snacks (optional). Below is an example of the itinerary: 9:00 Meet you at your hotel 10:00 Get to Mt. Takao by train. 10:00-15:00 Hike Mt. Takao 17:00 Come back to your hotel by train.
strTitle: Climb Mt Takao and refresh yourself in the beautiful nature

strIntroduction: The hit Philippine drama, "Born for You" has captured the hearts of many by telling the story of two fated lovers who formed their bond amidst the beauty of Japan. Many scenic sights around Tokyo and Mount Fuji was featured during the filming of this drama. Taking this tour will give you a chance to visit these places and learn more about the culture of this wonderful country. After picking you up at your hotel, the tour starts at Shibuya, known for being one of the hippest districts in Tokyo. A stone's throw away from Shibuya Station, you shall see the famous statue of Hachiko. A few steps more and you shall find the always crowded Shibuya scramble, the busiest pedestrian crossing in Japan. After your brief walking tour of Shibuya, you shall return to your vehicle which will transport you to Mt. Fuji. Visit the serene Sengen (Asama) Shrine, located in the midst of a dense forest surrounded by tall cedar trees. Visiting the shrine gives you a chance to learn about Japan's traditional religious beliefs which shall be explained by your knowledgeable tour guide. The bus will then proceed to Oshino Hakkai, where you can take time to wander around the scenic ponds surrounded by traditional Japanese thatched roof houses. This is the best place to take your lunch and buy traditional souvenirs for your friends and family back home. The last stop of the tour is Lake Kawaguchi. Stroll around this beautiful lake and see picture perfect views of Mount Fuji. After the tour, you shall be transported back to your hotel in Tokyo.
strTitle: Visit the Film Locations of Born for You in Japan

strIntroduction: Famous in winter as a ski destination, many people do not know that Hokkaido is best visited during summer, when this snow country gives way to vast fields of colorful flowers. Among the most popular are the lavender fields in Furano and sunflower fields in Biei. Sapporo, Hokkaido's capital is one of the best cities to visit in Japan. It has a vast number of attractions. Odori Park is the city's main park and lovely during summer. Ishiya Shiroi Koibito Factory is a chocolate factory turned into a museum and park. It shows the history of chocolate production in Japan and has a lot of interesting activities for both young and adult tourists. Hokkaido Shrine, the most sacred shrine in the region is located in the midst of a dense forest. Among the most popular places to visit in Hokkaido is Asahiyama Zoo. This zoo is home to various Arctic animals, from polar bears to penguins and seals. In here, you can also see animals that are found only in Hokkaido like the Hokkaido Brown Bear and Hokkaido Fox. The highlight of your visit to Hokkaido in summer are the lavender fields of Tomita Farm. The farm shows visitors the history of lavender farming in Japan which almost perished in the 1970s. Enjoy strolling in its vast colorful fields and try lavender products such as lavender ice cream. Your day-to-day itinerary is as follows: Day 1: Pick-up upon arrival at Shin-Chitose Airport by shared shuttle and transfer to your hotel Day 2: In the morning, pick-up by taxi from your hotel at 9 am. Drop-off at Sapporo Station Bus Terminal where you shall board the tour bus for a half-day tour of the city. Bus will pass-by Former Hokkaido Government Office Building and Odori Park before stopping over for your visit to Hokkaido Shrine. Afterwards, visit and tour Ishiya Shiroi Koibito Park. Next, proceed to Sapporo Central Wholesale Market where you may take your lunch (a lunch discount coupon will be provided). Pass-by Hokkaido Museum of Modern Art and Hokkaido Governor's Official Residence before returning to Sapporo Station Bus Terminal. Day 3: In the morning, pick-up by taxi from your hotel at 8:20 am. Drop-off at Sapporo Station Bus Terminal where you shall board the tour bus for a whole day excursion. Visit Asahiyama Zoo, stop-by Yukino Mura for lunch (lunch box is included), see the patchwork road, and visit Tomita Farm before returning back to Sapporo Station Bus Terminal. Day 4: Pick-up from your hotel at your preferred time and transfer to New Chitose Airport.
strTitle: Experience Summer in Hokkaido in a 4-day Package Tour

strIntroduction: This is a tour package for people who love "kawaii" culture in the best place in Japan to experience it: Harajuku. Spend a whole day immersed in cuteness with this package including unique and memorable experiences that will become the highlight of your trip. The package include the following activities: 1. Yukata experience (1 hour): Rent a yukata (traditional Japanese summer outfit) and stroll around the streets of Harajuku, then visit Meiji Jingu Shriene and take stunning pictures. 2. Ra.a.g.f Bunny café (30 minutes): Visit a bunny café in Omotesando street, where you will be able to choose your favorite bunny and pet it while you feed him or take lots of pictures. 3. Harajuku Lolita experience (1 hour): You can become a Harajuku lolita too! Embrace Japanese fashion and aesthetics as you wear extravagant outfits to turn yourself into an authentic Harajuku lolita! 4. J-pop idol concert Wrap up a very kawaii day with this j-pop idol concert, where you will see popular female idol groups sing catchy songs and deliver an amazing performance. Sit right in front of the stage and meet the girls after the show! Don't miss the chance to experience this unique, kawaii experiences for a discounted package price!
strTitle: Experience the best of Harajuku with the Kawaii tour package

strIntroduction: Termae-Yu is one of the largest hot springs in Japan, right in the middle of bustling Shinjuku! You will find 6 different kinds of indoor baths, an open-air bath with natural hot spring water brought straight from the Nakaizu hot spring area, two saunas, the largest high-concentration carbonated water bath in Japan featuring an elegant white marble interior as well as multiple relaxing spaces with comfortable chairs with monitors. The complex also features Japanese and ethnic cuisine restaurants, a spa for beauty treatments, a juice bar to refresh between baths, as well as lockers and changing room facilities. Take a break from the hectic traveler lifestyle and treat yourself to a relaxing day in a place that has everything you need to forget about your problems and leave you feeling relaxed from head to toe!
strTitle: Rest and relax at Termae-Yu hot springs in Shinjuku, Tokyo

strIntroduction: This is a beauty session where you will receive a full overall diagnosis of the current state of your skin, using the latest cosmetic and skin care technology to understand how to take care of if better and what products suit it best. You will also get a whitening facial massage that will rejuvenate your skin and leave it moistened for long after you come back home. This beauty session will not only leave your skin young and fresh again, but it will also give you important insights as to how you can take care of your skin in general and keep it beautiful for years to come. A delicious, healthy lunch is also included in the price and you will receive a gift set of SONOKO cosmetic mini-samples.
strTitle: Get a facial massage and skin diagnosis in Ginza, Tokyo

strIntroduction: After a long day of sightseeing and shopping in the trendy Harajuku district of Tokyo, why not pamper yourself and get a haircut at Ridicule Salon? Ridicule Salon has experienced and creative hairstylists with practical skills who will give you advice about the most suitable haircut for you and will treat your hair with the best care techniques available. All while you sit back and relax in the stylish atmosphere of the salon, filled with artwork and decorations that create a peaceful harmony. The staff will take good care of you and answer your question and concerns, always with a friendly smile. Getting a haircut at Ridicule Salon is the perfect way to take a break from the hectic pace of traveling and enjoy some time for yourself. You will get a new look and feel refreshed.
strTitle: Get a haircut and a new look at trendy Harajuku in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: This is a Real Escape Game experience in Asakusa, Tokyo, where you will be trapped inside a room with friends and/or strangers with a mission: to escape the room using the objects, symbols, words, and numbers around you to solve a series of puzzles and make it out of the room before the time runs out. This game will make you use your analytical skills as well as cooperate with your teammates to work out ingenious ways to solve the puzzles, which means you will have to learn to think out of the box in order to solve the puzzles before the time runs out. There are two different games available, the Red Box, and the Haunted Manor. The Red Box challenges you with clever puzzles that will open doors until you finally reach the last one while The Haunted Mansion is a themed game, where you have to solve a series of cases of missing people and enter the haunted manor to find out the truth about an alleged kidnapper in order to solve the mystery. Either way, you will have an amazing time playing these games, which are now offered in English and Chinese, so not knowing Japanese won't be an excuse to enjoy the thrill of fighting against the clock to solve your way out of these rooms! Challenge yourself and have a blast with your friends in this unique adventure, right in the middle of Tokyo!
strTitle: Experience a Real Escape Game in Asakusa, Tokyo

strIntroduction: Pick up at the Shimada Kanaya JR station. We will then visit Makinohara park where you can enjoy the view of Shimada and Kanaya area along the Ooi river. On a fine day you can see Mt. Fuji and the Japanese Southern Alps. After that we will visit the orchard and taste apples. You can pick as many apples as you want! If you like to buy some souvenirs, I can take you to some local shops. If you like to have some food or snacks, I can take you to a local restaurant or cafe. Enjoy a day in the countryside of Shizuoka!
strTitle: Pick apples in an orchard in Shizuoka

strIntroduction: First, we will explain about Japanese food, then you will learn how to cook 4 to 5 dishes. The cooking class will be in a traditional Japanese house. You can enjoy the Japanese traditional atmosphere. Lesson Contents: 10 minutes: Instruction and preparation 120 minutes: Demonstration and lesson 50 minutes: Tasting Menu: Main dish (fish, beef, pork or chicken), side dishes, miso soup and rice Time: 1 lesson: 3 hours Note: Please wear clothes that you don't mind getting dirty. Inquiries about allergy or Halal food are welcome. Please feel free to contact us.
strTitle: Enjoy Japanese home style cooking in Nara

strIntroduction: This is a half-day tour around Kamakura's highlights! Tour Course: Kamakura station ↓ Tsurugaoka Hachimangu Shrine ↓ Kamakura Komachidori ↓ Take Enoden ↓ Kotokuin (Great Buddha of Kamakura) ↓ Kamakura Seaside Yuigahama Area ↓ Take Enoden ↓ Kamakura station TIME From 12:00 pm to 16:30 pm (Ending time depends on the situation) Meeting place: Kamakura Station at the east gate *Please come by 11:45 pm Included: Entrance fee, Transportation fee during the tour Not include: Lunch Transportation fee from your hotel to Kamakura Station Group size: Minimum 2, Maximum 10 Notes: Barrier-free tour It is possible to join with a wheelchair or a buggy (At some area, guides will help)
strTitle: Take a Kamakura history and nature tour in English

strIntroduction: You do not have a chance to visit suburb of Tokyo when you are visiting Japan as tourist. We are going to visit a suburb of Tokyo (1 hour from Tokyo by train) and visit a shopping center and residential area to understand the lifestyle of Japanese people there. Shopping: The shopping center is larger compared to ones in Tokyo and most of the people are using a car to go there. The shopping center has supermarket, several restaurants, and specialty shops selling cloth, books, telephone and so on. You may find everything you need for your everyday live. People at suburbs like to shop at one location, therefore, you can find all the basic necessaries at there. People like to shop there during weekend since husbands can help wives to carry things. You can eat at the “common eating area” of the shopping center. You can find foods which are preferred by local people. A Home center is the place where you can buy your DIY (Do It Yourself) goods gardening, BBQ, pet products and so on. People who live in suburbs need those products more than city people. They enjoy nature / outdoor activities. On the other hand, professional people, such as carpenter, plasterer, and plumber also purchase tools and products there. Residential area Most people are working in Tokyo, commuting one hour and enjoying their family life in the weekend. Once they move to the suburb, they usually stay there for a long time, therefore the population in suburbs is aging. The number of nursing homes is increasing there. Costs of housing depends on size, age of building, distance to the station, and commuting time to Tokyo. It will cost you 20 million-60 million JPY for 60 ㎡-120㎡ condominium and a house there. It is an important to live near a train station since husbands need to commute to Tokyo every day. When it was developed 40 years ago, this area was not convenient to live at since there were not enough stores to shop. At that time, people needed to go to Tokyo to do their special shopping, such as suites, furniture, jewelry and so on. However, there are enough shops at the suburbs now and people do not need to go to Tokyo for their shopping. Schedule: Meet at your hotel 9:00 am Move to the suburb by train 9:00 - 10:00 Visit shopping center 10:30 - 11:30 Lunch 11:30 - 12:00 Visit home center 12:00 - 12:30 Visit residential area 13:00 – 13:30 Visit a home 13:30 – 14:00 Go back to your hotel 14:00 – 15:00
strTitle: Enjoy a shopping tour in a Tokyo suburb to see real life

strIntroduction: It takes about an hour to get to The Meiji-Mura Museum. We will use a train and a bus. Train and bus fee, as well as a museum ticket are included in the tour price. Feel the rural Japan when traveling by a local bus and train. The Meiji-Mura Museum's opening hours are different in every season: 9:30 a.m.-5:00 p.m. (Mar.-Jul., Sep., Oct.) 10:00 a.m.- 5:00 p.m. (Aug.) 9:30 a.m.-4:00 p.m. (Nov.) 10:00 a.m.-4:00 p.m. (Dec.-Feb.) So, departing time can change. Our guide can answer your question in English. In addition, we are now preparing a Chinese and Korean tour. About The Meiji-Mura Museum. There are 67 important and historic buildings. They were relocated from their original place. 10 of them are selected as important cultural properties by the Japanese government. There are not only old buildings, but also old steam locomotives imported from England and America. They still operate and you can ride them. One of them was made in 1874. Also, another old electric train is running (please look at photos). In addition, you can eat various foods in Meiji-Mura. You can find your favorite lunch there. You can experience the lifestyle of Japanese people from over 100 years ago. For example, you can wear old clothes and take photos of you dressed in those old clothes (needs additional fee).
strTitle: Take a Historic Tour in The Meiji-Mura Museum, Aichi

strIntroduction: About Hokkaido Consadole Sapporo: Hokkaido Consadole Sapporo is a Japanese professional football club, which plays in the J2 League. The team is based in Sapporo, on the island of Hokkaido. The club name "Consadole" is made from consado, a reverse of the Japanese word Dosanko (道産子, meaning "people of Hokkaido") and the Spanish expression Ole. 2016 Game Schedule: July 20th (Wed) 19:00- VS Matsumoto Yamaga FC 25th (Mon) 19:00- VS FC Gifu August 7th (Sun)14:00- VS Shimizu S-Pulse 14th (Sun)14:00- VS Montedio Yamagata September 26th (Mon)--:-- VS FC Machida Zelvia October 22th (Sat)--:-- VS Tokyo Verdy November 20th (Sun)--:-- VS Zweigen Kanazawa ※Game starting time depends on the day. Normally we meet up at JR Sapporo Station East gate about 2 hours before. We head to the game venue "Sapporo Dome" by subway. There, you can enjoy the game with some beer! Why do I do this? It's because if you do not know Japanese Language, it is quite difficult to watch the games or even get to the stadium. As I wrote in my profile, I'm a big fan of soccer and have been to many countries. When I was abroad and wanted to watch the games, it was always difficult to get the game tickets and know how to do this. So I would love to help soccer fans come to Sapporo. And also I would love to talk with you about soccer! FAQ: Q1. How can I confirm the tour schedule exactly? A1. I will send you a message about the schedule details in advance. Q2. I'm just 1 person. Can we join this tour? A2. Yes you can! This tour is from 1 person to 5 people. No worries! Q3. Can I cancel my tickets? A3. No you cannot cancel your ticket after your booking. Q4. How much for a beer at the stadium? A4. It's 650 JPY. You can choose from "YEBIS", "CLASSIC", "BLACK LABEL". ※Beer fee is not included in the tour fee. If you have any questions, please feel free to ask anything!
strTitle: Watch a J-League Soccer Game with local in Sapporo, Hokkaido

strIntroduction: Water games are always an exciting challenge for those who love outdoor and physical activity. It is also a great way of having fun with your friends and family. Water tubing on Seta River contains enough water to create strong push-and-pull force and tricky turns out of rapids. It's quite an adventure. First, after gathering, all participating guests are required to fill in the necessary forms and change into bathers. The equipment will then be distributed and you'll receive a detailed guide on how to work on the activity, including the following: training of safety procedures and how to use the equipment and manage when being flipped/turned. You'll be actually joining the game by floating down the rivers playing group games as we approach the rapids. Be prepared for a lot of spinning, big waves and a strong water force! Our guide is always there to help you. Have a good time and take a lot of commemorative photos. Please note that we will provide a life vest, helmet, rafting gear, wet suit and wet jacket (for cold season only). So please bring a swim suit, suitable footwear (wet shoes are available for rent), and swimming necessities.
strTitle: Experience a Unique Water Tubing Game, Shiga Prefecture

strIntroduction: Seta River is the only river running from its source of Lake Biwa in Osaka, and flowing downstream toward Kyoto Prefecture. So if you happen to be around the area, don't miss the chance to enjoy a fun and exciting rafting experience along the stream. It's a great 1-day trip. After gathering at the meeting point, all participating guests will have time to change into bathers and receive equipment used on the tour. The tour bus will take everyone to the start point. Here we will explain the procedures of safety, how to use the equipment and all other rules. We will have a rafting game between teams/boats while flowing along the stream toward the rapid part. After the rapid, the flow becomes calm again. This is the perfect time to enjoy the scenic view along the riverside and take commemorative photos together. When the tour has finished, the tour bus will take everyone back to the start point. Please note that we will provide a life vest, helmet, rafting gear, wet suit and wet jacket (for cold season only). So please bring a swim suit, suitable footwear (wet shoes are available for rent), and swimming necessities.
strTitle: Take on Rafting Challenge near Lake Biwa, Shiga Prefecture

strIntroduction: Lake Biwa has a a 400 million-year history and is known as one of the most famous lakes around the world. Wouldn't it be an amazing adventure to experience this beautiful landscape? Even if you've never tried canoeing before, this is a great activity for beginners as friendly staff will guide you every step of the way. A professional instructor will teach you the basics of riding and paddling. After the activity you can receive a special gift; a CD of photos from your amazing day! It's a great opportunity to make wonderful memories during your stay in Japan. Itinerary: Total: 60 minutes 15 minutes - Learning and practicing on land 40 minutes: Canoeing on the lake
strTitle: Go Canoeing on Lake Biwa in Shiga!

strIntroduction: This brand new activity available just this year is a great chance to do something unique and exciting with family and friends. It is called the "Lake Walker" and has been speedily growing in popularity in Japan. Everything you need to enjoy this activity is available at the site. Get ready for a challenging and fun time! The itinerary is as follows: - Learn about and practice Lake Walking on land. - Try to walk the rope in the lake. - Practice with assistance. - Take a small step forward. - Receive the gift of your photos on CD! Testing your concentration, balance and bravery is great to do with family and friends surrounded by the beautiful scenery of Lake Biwa. Make an unforgettable memory in Japan!
strTitle: Experience Walking on Water at Lake Biwa in Shiga!

strIntroduction: Lake Biwa is not only the biggest lake in Japan, it's also a place where you can enjoy water sports like canoeing, fishing and visiting historical buildings and designated sightseeing spots. Cycling along Lake Biwa is one of most the popular activities for tourists in Shiga prefecture. On the day of the tour, you will meet the guide at Shiga station (Kosei-line) which is about 40 minutes away from Kyoto station by local train. You will rent an electric-powered bicycle and helmet. Then, the start tour will begin. First, you will go cycling along the lakeside path toward the village of Kitafunaji. It’s beautiful and serene to ride a bicycle on a fine sunny morning. You can enjoy the view of the shimmering water surface, flowers and greenery by the lake shore. Kitafunaji area’s main product is rice. You can enjoy a peaceful and relaxing day as a guest of the traditional village located at the foot of the mountains. It’s going to be a unique experience to see a different side of Japan. At the rice field, you may try some of the farmers’ jobs like planting and harvesting depending on the season. After the farming activities, you will have lunch. The rice for your lunch is cooked in a special way, called “Nuka kudo”. The rice is shinier and more flavorful. If you are interested, you can participate in the cooking, as well. The food is served in bento-style lunch boxes full of seasonal ingredients. After lunch, you will visit a pottery gallery by the lake shore. The building is a 250-year-old house thatched with reeds. The pottery there is cracked glaze pottery. It’s beautiful and really unique. Lastly, You will go along the lakeside again back to Shiga Station where the tour will come to an end. Come along on this unique adventure and enjoy Japanese rural life!
strTitle: Enjoy Cycling Along the Shore of Lake Biwa in Shiga!

strIntroduction: Have fun on this unique adventure in Japan's beautiful, natural settings. You'll learn the basic skills of SUP: Stand Up Paddling at Lake Biwa in Shiga Prefecture. So what is SUP? It's similar to surfing, but boarders maintaining an upright stance and use a paddle to propel themselves through the water. This sport is growing in popularity all over the world and is a great and fun way to get in some exercise during your stay. This is a great class for beginners! The skilled instructors will help you every step of the way. Come out and enjoy the fun! Plan Details: Morning Plan: 9:40 a.m. Afternoon Plan: 12:10 a.m.
strTitle: Enjoy SUP: Stand Up Paddling at Lake Biwa in Shiga!

strIntroduction: This is a great activity to enjoy with family and friends while surrounded by beautiful nature. Guests will learn the basics of windsurfing at the famous Lake Biwa in Shiga Prefecture. This is a perfect class for beginners as the skilled instructors will guide you every step of the way from practice simulation to riding on the lake! This tour package comes with a short wide board, light carbon mast and non-batten sail for rental. Come out and enjoy the fun! Plan Details: Morning Plan: 9:40 a.m. Afternoon Plan: 12:10 p.m.
strTitle: Go on a Windsurfing Adventure at Lake Biwa in Shiga!

strIntroduction: Join our cultural activities in Tokyo! Here is the flow for each plan: ＊Photo shooting＊ 1: Please choose the costume that you want to try. 2: Change clothes. 3: Put make up and pick some accessories which fit with your costume. 4: Start shooting with our cameraman! 5: Choose the photos that you want to get. (We send those data via email in a few days.) *We will give you original photo book:) *All making up and dressing fee are included. ＊Shodo＊ 1: Instruction for using the tools. 2: Staff teaches you how to write Kanji, Katakana and Hiragana. 3: Look at examples of writing. 4: Try to write your favorite word! 5: You can bring it home. ＊Origami workshop＊ 1: Please choose your favorite Origami shape. 2: Pick some Origami parts for earring and Kanzashi decoration. 3: Make your own original accessory! Note: Please select either Shodo or Origami workshop when you book.
strTitle: Try Yukata, Anime Cosplay and Shodo Origami Workshop, Tokyo

strIntroduction: This is a one-day tour around the scenic and historic countryside spots in Shizuoka prefecture. Meet at the JR Kanaya Station in the morning around 9:30 am. Alternatively, I can pick you up at your hotel. Walk on the stone pavements of the Old Tokaido road. On the way you can see the stone statue of Jizo called Suberazu Jizo praying to passing travelers. Visit the ruins of Suwahara Castle and stroll the area amidst the green. It was built by Takeda Katsuyori at 1573 before the Edo era, and abandoned around 1590 aftter the destruction of the Takeda clan. After the walk you can have lunch: ordinary Japanese meals at a countryside-style restaurant. After enjoying lunch you can visit places related to Japanese potteries and folk arts in the neighbourhood. If you have interest in visiting the terraced rice paddies, there are some great fields nearby. You can get some souvenirs from your trip at the Fujisan Shizuoka Airport or nearby stations.
strTitle: Walk the stone-paved path of Old Tokaido & Ruins of Suwahara

strIntroduction: ☆Greet your guide at Yurakucho Station and embark upon your epicurean exploration of the city. Immerse yourself in the electric atmosphere of Yakitori Alley, an atmospheric enclave replete with informal restaurants serving delectable yakitori (grilled chicken skewers). ☆Next, venture to Monja Street to sample the local delicacy of monjayaki, a pan-fried pancake favored by locals. Learn about the snack’s interesting origin as you chat to your chef and listen to your pancake sizzling on the grill before nibbling the strips using chopsticks. ☆Continue to tantalize your taste buds in Ginza, an enticing district thronged with confectionery shops, while learning about the rich variety of Japanese sweets. I'll show you luxurious sweets spots where you can find a $500USD melon, some traditionally and beautifully arranged desserts and see the famous landmarks of Tokyo's most expensive real estate area! then conclude your culinary tour at a Ginza station. Bid your guide and group farewell but feel free to remain in the most sophisticated area after the tour concludes.
strTitle: 60% OFF Taste Japanese food in a 3-hour Tokyo izakaya tour

strIntroduction: Shizuoka prefecture is home to the iconic Mt. Fuji standing at 3,776 meters high, however it's also rich in beautiful coastal landscapes, tea plantations, and it's filled with Shinto shrines and Buddhist temples of great significance. With this 6 hour long private car tour of the surroundings of Shizuoka city, you will be able to explore the area in a short amount of time, while enjoying the comfort that a private car with guide and all the entrance fees to the attractions taken care for you. You will start the tour at Shimizu port, and ride along Shizouka's shore to admire the beautiful landscape of the Pacific ocean meeting the mountains. You will then visits unmissable sights like the Shizuoka Sengen shrine, dedicated to Mt. Fuji and famous for being the place where Tokugawa-Ieyasu, the famous warlord of Japan made his coming-of-age ceremony. You will then visit Rinzai-ji Temple, with its stunning garden that has been designated as a National Site of Scenic Beauty of Japan. After that, you will head to the ruins of Shizuoka Castle, also known as Sunpu Castle, built by Tokugawa Ieyasu in 1586. Only a portion of the castle that has been rebuilt can be visited, however it's location inside a park and its beautiful gardens make it a beautiful sight to visit. The next stop on the tour will be Nihondaira scenic area, from which you will be able to take in breathtaking views of Mt. Fuji and take impressive pictures. You can also stroll around the area and indulge in typical Shizouka green tea flavored taiyaki treats or a wasabi ice-cream. From there, you will visit Kunozan Toshogu Shrine and Kunozan Toshogu Museum, sites filled with historical treasures that will transport you to the time of the samurai. Don't miss the chance to enjoy an amazing tour of one of Japan's most beautiful regions, Shizuoka prefecture.
strTitle: Explore Shizuoka in a shore excursion tour from Shimizu Port

strIntroduction: Kochi is the capital of Kochi prefecture located in Shikoku, one of Japan's main islands. It's a small city nestled between rugged mountains to the north and a sandy arc-like coast to the south. It's a friendly city with a relaxed atmosphere and it's full of historical and natural sightseeing spots. A great way to explore it in a short amount of time is with this 6 hour private car tour visiting the most popular sights. This tour will take you to historical sites such as Kochi Castle, built in 1611 when it became the seat of the Yamauchi lords, who used to rule over the region and now houses local treasures and historical objects. At Katsurahama beach, you will be able to enjoy the sun and beautiful landscapes, as well as visit locals sites such as the Sakamoto Ryoma Museum, dedicated to a prominent figure in the Meiji restoration who was born in Kochi, as well as the Tosa dog Museum, featuring displays and exhibitions about the history of dog fighting in the region. Ride in a comfortable car that will pick you up at the airport or at Kochi station, and take you to all the sightseeing spots without any hassle. At the end of the tour, the car will drop you off at your hotel or the airport. Don't miss this chance to explore Kochi's most interesting sights with this convenient and comfortable tour.
strTitle: Shore excursion around the best highlights of Kochi

strIntroduction: Join this tour program to enjoy the ultimate water sports experiences at Seta River in Shiga prefecture! You can enjoy both river bugging and water rafting, or river bugging and water tubing at once with this tour program! River bugging let you stride along the river and move around freely on the water surface just like a water's strider. Water tubing let you feel the force of the river water and the speed of the water. Water Rafting let you stroll around the Seta river with your team. Seta River is the only spot for river bugging and water tubing in Japan, and it is one of the most famous white water rafting sites in Japan. This tour also includes the equipment for all water sports activities, so you can join this tour with no hassles at all! Please come to the base camp at the Seta River 15 minutes before the scheduled time to register yourself! You will be asked to fill out the necessary forms change into bathers. The equipment will also be distributed and our car will take you the starting points of the river bugging. Before starting the water sports activities, we will go through procedures for safety, how to use the equipment, and how to recover after being flipped over, etc. You will also have time to practice before starting the activities. River bugging, water tubing, and water rafting are very enjoyable, since you can feel the way the water of the river moves while striding along the river. You can feel water force of the river hitting your body directly and enjoy the rapid moves of the river! You can choose the river combo if you want to enjoy river bugging and water rafting, which starts at 9:30 and ends at 15:30. If you want to enjoy double sensations, you can choose the ultimate combo of river bugging and water tubing, which starts at 10:00 and ends at 16:00. The conditions of the participants for the river combo should be people who are 13 - 58 years old who are healthy in mind and body (those under 18 years old must obtain consent from parents). The conditions of the participants for the ultimate combo should be people who are 16 - 58 years old who are healthy in mind and body (those under 18 years old must obtain consent from parents). People whose height is under 175 cm and weight is over 100 kg may not participate in the tour, due to problems related to rescue procedures. In addition, women who are pregnant and people who have health issues or hear problems should not join this tour. strIntroduction: Join this tour program to enjoy the river bugging activity at Seta River in Shiga prefecture! River bugging activity is similar to "water's strider" activity, means that you can stride along the river and move around freely on the water's surface just like a water's strider! This tour also includes the equipment for river bugging, so you can join this tour with no hassles at all! Please come to the base camp at the Seta River 15 minutes before the scheduled time to register yourself! You will be asked to fill out the necessary forms change into bathers. The equipment will also be distributed and our car will take you the starting points of the river bugging. Before starting the river bugging, we will go through procedures for safety, how to use the equipment, and how to recover after being flipped over, etc. We use fins and hand paddles for river bugging, so it will be easy to move on the water surface. You will have time to practice before starting the river bugging. River bugging is a very fun activity, since you can feel the way the water of the river moves while striding along the river. You can feel water force of the river hitting your body directly and enjoy the rapid moves of the river! There are two sessions available daily for river bugging. The A.M. session starts from 10:00 to 12:30, and the P.M. session starts from 14:00 - 16:30. The conditions of the participants for river bugging should be people who are 15 - 58 years old who are healthy in mind and body (those under 18 years old must obtain consent from parents). People whose height is under 175 cm and weight is over 100 kg may not participate in the tour, due to problems related to rescue procedures. In addition, women who are pregnant and people who have health issues or hear problems should not join this tour. Please inform us the hotel where you will be staying as we will send you the directions to the base camp at the Seta River to your e-mail. Reservation is difficult to make, so we suggest you to use our reservation service to book with no hassles! Join this tour program and spend your wonderful summer with this river bugging program!

After watching kabuki, we'll hang around Ginza and enjoy seeing and shopping ukiyoe (woodblock print), sensu (folding fan) and other Japanese traditional goods - beautiful chopsticks, colourful washi (Japanese paper), fine incense. You can also taste delicious bean jam-filled buns or traditional crafted senbei snacks - rice cracker. *Please keep in mind the following rules when you watch kabuki: 1. strIntroduction: None of Japan’s traditional spiritual pursuits synthesizes a greater number of separate indigenous artistic practices than does Tea ceremony. In its fullest form, this praxis combines flower-arrangement, calligraphy, ceramics, lacquer-work, architecture, garden-design, cuisine, incense-use, and very much more. Sharing hospitality with your fellow-guests, and doing this in an appropriate manner, will afford you an understanding of a praxis that has, since the fifteenth century, never ceased to combine formalized hospitality and social interaction with simultaneous meditation. And yet that is far from all. For the visitor, a dedicated Tea-occasion also constitutes an ideal environment in which to learn more about – and to come better to understand – several principal features of both Japanese culture and Japanese history. Such may be claimed because many aspects of this praxis are imbued with elements that are either key to Japanese culture, or else faithful reflections of the historical needs and circumstances out of which this unique rite developed. By taking full part in a Tea-occasion, you yourself will supply that very element which is crucial to this ritual – the Tea-guest. For what essentially guarantees successful unfolding of so gentle a process is harmony generated between both host and guest, and also – equally importantly – between guest and fellow-guest. Only through proactive participation can you experience something of a true realization of those goals, which practitioners of Tea ceremony unflaggingly pursue. (While those goals are indeed spiritual, at the same time, they in no way conflict with the tenets of any known religious creed or affiliation.) Rather than remaining a mere outsider-consumer of Japan-as-spectacle, come and become part of our Tea-ceremony session, thereby constituting a vital contribution to this sociable rite, and thus making an initial understanding of its essence your very own. It is the Tea Crane’s dearest wish that, when you return home, and the people you care for ask you what of Japan has left the deepest impression within you, you will at once answer ‘a Tea-ceremony workshop that I decided to attend: once it had ended, I found that I now understood so much’.
strTitle: Attend an Authentic Tea Ceremony Workshop in Kyoto

strIntroduction: In this activity you will visit a local Japanese in Osaka and will cook and eat Japanese home-cooked dishes! In addition, you can try making origami and calligraphy! In Japan, we have four seasons so we can eat different dishes in every season. Instead of going to a restaurant, have a taste of home-style Japanese dishes at my home. I'll serve you tasteful dishes. I can also teach you how to cook and you can learn different ingredients and Japanese recipes. After the wonderful lunch, you can try origami and also enjoy calligraphy with me. You may also choose to go to an old market. I'll take you there. Enjoy the taste of Japan with a local, with a warm tea and a chat! The menu will consist of the following: - shabu-shabu (cold or hot) - dashimaki-tamago (Japanese rolled eggs) - yakizakana (fried fish) - futomaki rolls (we can make them together) - nimono (simmered dish)
strTitle: Enjoy Japanese homecooked meals, origami and calligraphy!

strIntroduction: When you think of Aomori prefecture, apples come to mind! Hirosaki Apple Park has approximately 65 types of apples and 1,300 apple trees. In the fall, you can try apple picking. Cider Factory Kimori, located in the park, lets you try refreshing cider that tastes as if it was pressed straight from an apple (separate fee required). Hirosaki Castle has a history of over 400 years. Today, it is in the midst of being moved, so you can see the castle without its stone-wall base, something seen only once in 100 years. In addition, in Inakadate you can tour rice paddy art that uses the land as a canvas and has become famous worldwide. There is also a tour of the workshop run by the sword smith, Mitsugu Nakahata who has crafted Japanese swords for many years. While listening to explanations from the sword smith, you can take a sword in hand for a close look. A lunch featuring local foods will be prepared. Enjoy a leisurely lunch at a farmhouse restaurant that doesn't have a menu--it serves whatever has been freshly picked that day. After strolling around Hirosaki Park, sit down with a cup of coffee at a Starbucks housed in a cultural property (coffee is a separate fee). The final leg of the tour takes you to a market very popular with the locals that sells foods unique to the area and miscellaneous goods at reasonable prices. Have fun communicating with the women of the market! This 1-day tour lets you experience an abundance of the enchantment of both Aomori's past and present! Schedule: 9:00 Gather at Joto Exit, Hirosaki Station; meet up with the guide and travel to Inakadate in a vehicle (van or regular taxi) 9:20 Arrive at No.2 rice paddy art site (there is a wait time when crowded) 10:00 Arrive at No.1 rice paddy art site (there is a wait time when crowded) 10:30 Tour Katana no Iori (Japanese sword workshop) and actually handle a Japanese sword 12:00 Lunch of local dishes at a farmhouse restaurant; Japanese meals are prepared from vegetables freshly picked that day from the restaurant's backyard garden 13:30 Arrive at Hirosaki Apple Park; tour Cider Factory Kimori in the park 14:45 Tour Hirosaki Castle in Hirosaki Park 15:30 Have a cup of coffee at a Starbucks housed in a cultural property *Participants are responsible for paying for their coffee 16:15 Tour Niji no Mart (popular local market) and shop 17:00 Arrive at main entrance to Hirosaki Station; end tour A shorter budget version of this tour using public transportation is available. If you book the budget version, the itinerary will be as follows: 9:00 Gather at Joto Exit, Hirosaki Station; meet up with the guide and travel to Inakadate by train 9:20 Arrive at No.2 rice paddy art site (there is a wait time when crowded) 10:00 Arrive at No.1 rice paddy art site (there is a wait time when crowded). Go back to No. 2 rice paddy art site by shuttle bus and go to Hirosaki by train 12:00 Lunch at a restaurant in Hirosaki city. After lunch, go to Hirosaki Apple Park. 13:30 Arrive at Hirosaki Apple Park; tour Cider Factory Kimori in the park. Go to Hirosaki Park by bus. 15:00 Tour Hirosaki Castle in Hirosaki Park 16:30 Have a cup of coffee at a Starbucks housed in a cultural property *Participants are responsible for paying for their coffee 17:00 Arrive at main entrance to Hirosaki Station; end tour

strIntroduction: At Oirase Keiryu, spend a languid time eating meals made from whole Aomori apples and bathing in a bath overlooking the grand nature of Oirase while surrounded by a forest. On Day 2, travel to the port town of Hachinohe where you'll be shown 8 backstreets with bars only found in a town where a unique port-town culture has been firmly entrenched since long ago. Get an early start on Day 3. Walk around an area full of old-fashioned markets, including Municipal Hachinohe Gyosai-Ichiba Market that was opened in 1953. There, you can enjoy talking with the chatty local ladies. The fresh seafood you eat at this area from bygone days is fantastic! This tour will energize you with nature and people power. strIntroduction: Hachinohe is a town where a unique port-town culture has been firmly entrenched since long ago. strIntroduction: Fully enjoy the beautiful scenery of Tanesashi Kaigan. There is a pathway offering an easy trekking course. All 5 of your senses will be stimulated by pleasant sea breezes on your skin, the sound of the waves, the smell of the ocean, and the soft ground of the pine forest. Data has been released showing that walking along the Tanesashi coastline relieves stress and is good for your health. At the fishing port located at the end of the trekking path, you can experience the life of fishermen and enjoy a meal made with freshly caught seasonal seafood. In the evening, head to Oirase Keiryu where you'll go from the ocean to being enveloped in a forest. Spend a languid time eating meals made from whole Aomori apples and bathing in a bath overlooking the grand nature of Oirase. strIntroduction: Use transportation tickets and admission tickets to save money and travel to sightseeing spots in Aizu at your own pace. Depart whenever you like! Get tickets for the Machinaka Shuyu (sightseeing) Bus, good for 1–2 days and for admission to Tsuruga Castle, Miyaizumi Brewery, and Aizu samurai residence.
strTitle: Get Aizu sightseeing bus tickets and attraction tickets!

strIntroduction: This is a 2-day tour to explore to history and samurai spirit of Aizu area! On Day 1, you'll visit Takizawa Honjin (a national important cultural property), Mt. Iimori where the Byakkotai warriors committed suicide by sword, Dairyu-ji Temple where the ancestors of Niijima Yae are buried, and Tsuruga Castle, which has a beautiful red-brick castle tower that is the symbol of Aizu. Stay overnight in a hotel in Higashiyama Onsen, which has long been loved by prominent figures. On Day 2, go to samurai residences and the gravesite of Matsudaira located in a spacious historic mountainside spot where generations of feudal lords from the Matsudaira family are buried. Enjoy a lunch of local foods. You'll travel by reserved taxi, so you can sightsee at your own pace. Schedule: Day 1 Depart from Aizu-Wakamatsu Station; go to Takizawa Honjin, Mt. Iimori (site of the Byakkotai suicides), Dairyu-ji Temple, and Tsuruga Castle; arrive at a Higashiyama Onsen hotel Day 2 Depart from the hotel: go to the Matsudaira gravesite, samurai residences, birthplace of Yae (view from the taxi), Shinsengumi Museum, and Tagoto (lunch); arrive at Aizu-Wakamatsu Station.
strTitle: 2-Day Tour in Aizu: Appreciate the history & samurai spirit

strIntroduction: This is the definitive chance to experience the culture of Aizu! Try painting a beautifully colorful Aizu erosoku candle (or paint a red akabeko toy cow), and make Japanese sweets that have been enjoyed since long ago. You can also tour a sake brewery and see how lacquerware is made to learn about the culture of sake and lacquerware in Aizu. A taxi reserved for the tour is used so you can depart when you like. Schedule: Depart from Aizu-Wakamatsu Station; try making Aizu crafts (painting erosoku candles or a red akabeko toy cow); make Japanese sweets from Aizu; tour Suehiro Sake Brewery/Kaeigura and Suzuen Lacquerware Shop (Aizu lacquerware); arrive at Aizuwakamatsu Station, a hotel in Aizu-Wakamatsu City, or Higashiyama Onsen.
strTitle: Half-day Tour in Aizu: Hands-on experiences with local craft

strIntroduction: Take this tour and enjoy age-old culture and amazing scenery. Try your hand at creating pottery in the town known for pottery, Aizumisato in Fukushima prefecture. Walk around Ouchijuku (a former post station), one of the few places in Japan that still boasts an historic streetscape. Enjoy the well-known dish, green onion soba noodles, and view To-no-Hetsuri, a beautiful scenic cliff of strangely-shaped rocks produced by a million years of erosion and weathering. Then, alleviate your fatigue from the trip by soaking in a foot bath at a thatch-roofed station building. A taxi reserved for the tour is used so you can depart when you like. Schedule: Depart from Aizu-Wakamatsu Station; try making Hongo pottery (500g) at Aizu-Misato (if the pottery can't be sent by post, the hands-on experience will be changed to painting Aizu lacquerware); go to Ouchijuku (eat the well-known green onion soba for lunch); try the foot bath at Yunokami-Onsen Station; view To-no-Hetsuri; arrive at Aizu-Wakamatsu Station, a hotel in Aizu-Wakamatsu City, or Higashiyama Onsen.
strTitle: One day Tour in Aizu: Make pottery and see pretty scenery

strIntroduction: The 33 temples on the 33 Kannon pilgrimage are in Aizu, Fukushima prefecture, which is a city of Buddhism. Of those temples, it is said that worshipping at the popular Aizu Korori San Kannon (Nakata Kanseon, Tachiki Kannon, and Torioi Kannon) will give you peace of mind and health. This compact tour will take you to the three temples of Aizu Korori San Kannon. Schedule: Depart from Aizu-Wakamatsu Station; visit Aizu Korori San Kannon (Nakata Kannon, Tachiki Kannon, and Torioi Kannon); arrive at Aizu-Wakamatsu City, Higashiyama Onsen, or Atsushio Onsen (approx. 3.5 hrs.)
strTitle: Half-day Tour in Aizu: Visit Aizu Korori San Kannon

strIntroduction: Embark on the 33 temple Kannon pilgrimage that is said to have a history of over 350 years in the Buddhist city of Aizu. The group of cultural properties was chosen as a Japanese Heritage, a designation given by the Agency for Cultural Affairs. The temples are fascinating properties that speak of the culture and traditions of Japan. Many of the temples dedicated to the goddess, Kannon quietly stand in villages. It is said that simply pilgrimaging to them will bring blessings. This plan visits all 33 Kannon temples in 2 days. A taxi reserved for the tour is used so you can depart when you like and get to out-of-the-way temples with no problems. Schedule: Day 1 10:00 Depart Aizu-Wakamatsu Station; embark on the Aizu 33 temple Kannon pilgrimage (approx. 18 temples) 17:00 Aizu-Wakamatsu City, Higashiyama Onsen, or Atsushio Onsen (stay overnight) Day 2 9:00 Depart from Aizu-Wakamatsu City, Higashiyama Onsen, or Atsushio Onsen; continue the Aizu 33 temple Kannon pilgrimage (approx. 15 temples) 16:00 Aizu-Wakamatsu Station
strTitle: 2-Day Tour in Aizu: 33 Kannon pilgrimage and good fortune

strIntroduction: Hirosaki is an interesting city that blends Japanese and Western styles. In a Western-style building located in the beautiful Fujita Memorial Japanese Garden, try making original Japanese sweets under the instruction of an actual professional maker of Japanese sweets. Then, enjoy the Japanese sweets you made with green tea. You can also stroll in the garden. Schedule: 8:30 Gather at the main entrance, Hirosaki Station; meet up with the guide and travel to Fujita Memorial Japanese Garden by public bus 9:00 Arrive at Fujita Memorial Japanese Garden; try making 3 types (planned) of Japanese sweets under the instruction of a Japanese sweets maker in a Western-style building. Afterwards, enjoy the sweets with green tea. You can also take them home. Then, the guide will show you around the Japanese garden. 11:30 Take the public bus to Hirosaki Station 12:00 Arrive at the main entrance to Hirosaki Station; end tour
strTitle: Half-Day Tour in Hirosaki, Aomori: Make Japanese sweets

strIntroduction: When you think of Aomori prefecture, apples come to mind! Hirosaki Apple Park has approximately 65 types of apples and 1,300 apple trees. In the fall, you can try apple picking. Cider Factory Kimori, located in the park, lets you try refreshing cider that tastes as if it was pressed straight from an apple (separate fee required). Hirosaki Castle has a history of over 400 years. Today, it is in the midst of being moved, so you can see the castle without its stone-wall base, something seen only once in 100 years. At the Zenringai district, which has a strong historical relationship with Hirosaki Castle, you can also experience Zen meditation. Your spirit will be refreshed. After eating the popular local ramen, sit down with a cup of coffee at an unusual Starbucks housed in a cultural property (coffee is a separate fee). Schedule: 8:30 Gather at Joto Exit, Hirosaki Station; meet up with the guide and travel to Hirosaki Apple Park in a vehicle (van or regular taxi) 9:00 Arrive at Hirosaki Apple Park; tour Cider Factory Kimori in the park 10:15 Tour Hirosaki Castle in Hirosaki Park 11:00 Experience Zen meditation at Zenringai, where there are 33 temples, all of the Soto school of Zen 12:00 Eat lunch at a local popular ramen shop, Niboshi Chuka 12:40 Have a cup of coffee at a Starbucks housed in a cultural property *Participants are responsible for paying for their coffee 13:20 Arrive at main entrance to Hirosaki Station; end tour If traveling to Oirase Keiryu: After the tour, depart from the main entrance at Hirosaki Station at 13:26. Ride the bus going to Aomori Airport (1,000 yen) and arrive at the airport at 14:20. Take the free shuttle bus departing Aomori Airport at 15:00 going to Oirase Keiryu Hotel. If you stay at Oirase Keiryu Hotel the day before, you can take the same route in the opposite direction. (Lunch will be later at 14:00.)
strTitle: Half-Day Tour in Tsugaru, Aomori: Hirosaki's past & present

strIntroduction: There is also a tour of the workshop run by the sword smith, Mitsugu Nakahata who has crafted Japanese swords for many years in Inakadate. While listening to explanations from the sword smith, you can take a sword in hand for a close look. A lunch featuring local foods will be prepared. Enjoy a leisurely lunch at a farmhouse restaurant that doesn't' have a menu--it serves whatever has been freshly picked that day. The tour ends at an early hour so that afterwards you can readily travel to Oirase Keiryu (mountain stream). Schedule: 8:30 Gather at Joto Exit, Hirosaki Station; meet up with the guide and travel to Inakadate in a vehicle (van or regular taxi) 9:00 Arrive at No.2 rice paddy art site (there is a wait time when crowded) 9:40 Arrive at No.1 rice paddy art site (there is a wait time when crowded) 10:15 Tour Katana no Iori (Japanese sword workshop) and actually handle a Japanese sword 11:40 Lunch of local dishes at a farmhouse restaurant; Japanese meals are prepared from vegetables freshly picked that day from the restaurant's backyard garden 12:50 Tour Niji no Mart (popular local market) and shop *Go to roadside station on Sundays. 13:20 Arrive at main entrance to Hirosaki Station; end tour If traveling to Oirase Keiryu: After the tour, depart from the main entrance at Hirosaki Station at 13:26. Ride the bus going to Aomori Airport (1,000 yen) and arrive at the airport at 14:20. Take the free shuttle bus departing Aomori Airport at 15:00 going to Oirase Keiryu Hotel. If you stay at Oirase Keiryu Hotel the day before, you can take the same route in the opposite direction. (Lunch will be later at 14:00.)
strTitle: Half-Day Tour in Aomori: Rice paddy Art and Japanese Swords

strIntroduction: This course lets you enjoy the ocean in Miyagi prefecture to the fullest for a day. The aquarium has dynamic dolphin and sea lion shows, large and impressive water tanks, and an exhibit of exceptional animals from around the world. The market boasts an array of shops and products; at lunchtime, you can buy fresh seafood and cook it right there, or create your own rice bowl with seafood. After lunch, take a walk around Matsushima, one of Japan's 3 most scenic spots, and take in the beautiful views of Matsushima Bay. Take a stroll around the temples. Schedule: 10:00 Gather at Sendai Station 10:40–12:10 Shiogama Seafood Wholesale Market, walk about and have lunch 12:40–14:20 Stroll around Matsushima 14:40–16:30 Tour Sendai Umino-Mori Aquarium 17:00 End tour (at Sendai Station)
strTitle: 1-Day Ocean-Themed Tour: Visit aquarium & Matsushima,Miyagi

strIntroduction: The northern area of Miyagi prefecture was once a castle town and prospered through trading. This tour lets you walk around Tome, an area of warehouse-style merchant homes and buildings reminiscent of the Meiji period. This district, which is abundantly blessed with delicious rice and water, devoted efforts to brewing sake. There are breweries here and there that create unique, high-quality sake. You can tour Ichinokura, a sake brewery that represents Miyagi prefecture, and taste Japanese sake. There is also a lunch featuring delicious Sendai beef. Schedule: 9:00 Gather at Sendai Station, travel to Tome 10:45–11:45 Walk around samurai residences 12:15–13:25 Lunch 13:55–14:40 Sake Museum 15:10–16:00 Tour the sake brewery 17:00 End tour (at Sendai Station)
strTitle: 1-Day Tour in Miyagi: Experience Sendai Beef and Local Sake

strIntroduction: Akayu hot springs town is located slightly north of Yonezawa in Yamagata. From there, drive approximately 30 minutes and you'll encounter Nagai, a city where traditional buildings still remain. Numerous historic buildings still stand in this district, including sake breweries, a soy sauce brewery, and the home of a kimono dealer that was in business for 300 years. Tour this romantic townscape in a retro taxi. You can also ride on the local line, Flower Nagai Line and savor the view from the window. You'll also meet the rabbit "stationmaster" named Mocchi at Miyauchi Station. This half-day tour offers a full experience of small-town Yamagata, perfect for people who want to experience a Japan that is off the beaten path. Schedule: 13:00 Gather at JR Akayu Station 13:10–16:00 Tour a soy sauce shop, sake brewery, Kozakurakan, and Kendama Plaza 16:20–16:46 Travel on the Flower Nagai Line from Nagai Station to Miyauchi Station; meet the rabbit "stationmaster" 18:13–18:19 Travel from Miyauchi Station to Akayu Station The price includes: Sightseeing taxi fare, toll road fees, parking fees
strTitle: Half-Day Tour in Yamagata: See a rabbit "stationmaster"!

strIntroduction: There is a lot to do and see at Geibikei Gorge in southern Iwate prefecture. You can listen to the boatman's songs and stories while gliding down the river, and get off at the riverbank and go for a walk. The lunch served on board is prepared with local ingredients. Enjoy each season-delight in the new greenery in spring and summer, in the fall foliage in autumn, and the boat's kotatsu heater in winter. After the boat ride, you can make your own washi paper that is unique in all the world. On Day 2, visit Chuson-ji Temple and Motsu-ji Temple in Hiraizumi to view the wonderful World Heritage Site, the Golden Hall, a garden, and Buddhist works of art. It is a beautiful place famous for being where the poet, Matsuo Basho read poetry. This tour is perfect for visitors who want to leisurely soak up the history and nature of Tohoku. Schedule: Day 1 11:00 Gather at Ichinoseki Station 12:00 Eat lunch while sailing down Geibikei Gorge 14:00 Papermaking 15:30 Tour Motsu-ji Temple 16:30 Go to Hiraizumi Hotel Musashibo Day 2 9:00 Visit Chuson-ji Temple; walk around the vicinity, move by regular sightseeing bus 12:00 Lunch at Sekinoichi (brewery restaurant) 13:30 End tour (at Ichinoseki Station) Price Includes: Day 1: Sightseeing taxi fare, parking fees, Geibikei Gorge boat fare, hotel fee, meal charge (1 breakfast; 1 lunch; 1 dinner)
strTitle: 2-Day Tour, Sail downstream & Tour World Heritage Site,Iwate

strIntroduction: If you come to the city of Sendai, you should take this tour to visit all the must-see sightseeing spots in one day. You can also enjoy the breathtaking beauty of Akiu Waterfall, soak your feet in hot springs in the onsen district, and take walks. At lunchtime, satisfy your appetite with local foods at a market near Akiu onsen. There is shopping as well. Plus, participants can also discover history by visiting Aoba Castle and Zuihoden Mausoleum, associated with one of Japan's leading military commanders, Date Masamune. Schedule: 10:30 Gather at Sendai Station; visit Akiu Waterfall, Agurie no Mori (lunch), Aoba Castle, Zuihoden Mausoleum 4:00 Arrive at Sendai Station
strTitle: 1-Day Nature & History Tour in Sendai, Miyagi Prefecture

strIntroduction: Tour Tashirojima, a sanctum for cat lovers, and Matsushima, one of Japan's 3 most scenic spots. On Tashirojima, where cats outnumber humans, cats roam free and visitors can interact with them. You can also enjoy this sleepy island by exploring walking paths, small beaches, and the cat shrine. Later, stroll around Matsushima, one of Japan's 3 most scenic spots, and take in the beauty of Matsushima Bay and its temples. This tour is perfect if you love island walks and cats. On the "Cat Island" of Tashirojima, feel free to interact with the cats, take a walk along the beach, and visit the cat shrine. On Matsushima, take pleasure in the beautiful landscape, eat delicious island foods, and stroll around. Schedule: Day 1 11:15 Gather at Ishinomaki Station; go to Ishinomaki Port by sightseeing taxi 12:00 Depart by ferry for Tashirojima 13:04 Arrive at Tashirojima, walk around (free time) 15:33 Leave Tashirojima 16:46 Arrive at Ishinomaki Port; go to Ishinomaki Station by sightseeing taxi 17:25 Travel from Ishinomaki Station to Matsushima Kaigan Station (JR Senseki Line) 18:10 Go to Hotel Matsushima Taikanso from Matsushima Kaigan Station by taxi Day 2 After checkout, travel by hotel shuttle bus; stroll around Matsushima (free time) and see Entsu-in Temple, Zuigan-ji Temple, etc.; return home at your leisure Price Includes: Day 1: Round-trip taxi fare from Ishinomaki Station to Ishinomaki Port, hotel fee, meal charge (1 breakfast; 1 dinner) *Does not include Day 1
strTitle: 2-Day Tour to "Cat Island" Tashirojima & Matsushima, Miyagi
